Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, and reasonably price (for downtown TO)”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_Brewster
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Marriott is bright, clean, and modern. I enjoyed the fluffy hypoallergenic feather pillows, and there were plenty of them (I often ask for extra pillows if there are only two in the room). We got a reasonably-priced room through an online website. In a good location in Toronto, walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops. Cost of parking was reasonable compared to other downtown hotels – park in the lot next door.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in midtown”
Reviews.Author: MM2424
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago for one night and had a HORRIBLE sleep. The walls are paper thin and I heard every noise, all night. There are better options in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... Poor Climate Control”
Reviews.Author: k_keho
Reviews.Content: The quality of the hotel & rooms was great. Rooms were large, very clean, location was great and most of the staff were very helpful. Small complaint, maybe my fault for not understanding that Yorkville is very trendy and equally expensive area of Toronto, but wait staff at the Bar, ESPECIALLY THE BARTENDER, left much to be desired. Maybe because we were not in suits & ties, but the bartender was Rude and Arrogant to the point that we left after 20 minutes and there was no one in the bar, so it's not like we were unfairly taking up any of his time. The major complaint... temperatures in the rooms. I understand that we had unseasonably warm weather for March 16-18 and that it takes time to get an A/C system up and running, but temperature in both our rooms ranged from 78F to 82F (25C-27C) ALL NIGHT despite trying every setting possible on the in-room thermostat. When hadn't fallen asleep by 4:00am, went down to lobby to inquire. The desk clerk said it shouldn't be that hot... but couldn't offer help. Lucikly another hotel guest was behind me checking out, and indicated he had the same problem for 3 nights, had spoken to maintence and indicated all you could do is turn the thermostat completly off, as even when set to 60F it would still be pushing warm air into the room.. desk staff didn't know anything about this solution. Once turned off, room temperature dropped to 75F but nothing more could be done. Didn't get much sleep in a hotel ONLY BOOKED FOR SLEEPING.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: atti2ud
Reviews.Content: Great renovated hotel right next to the Toronto Transit Subway. Easy check in, The room was a king bed new tv, great bedding very clean and inviting. At night very quiet. We did not eat at the hotel, never do with great restaurants available, so we ate at milestones on younge across from the Eaton centre great steak. We Pricelined the room so only paid $ 90.00 US. The negatives to avoid, go around back and park the car yourself 20 bucks overnight. If you use the valet parking it's 35 plus tip so 40 bucks. Don't take taxis, too expensive when the TTC is right at the door. There is a all day breakfast restaurant right on the corner go there, good food and cheap for Toronto. Anyway I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Jenylyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a "business retreat" with 3 days of intensive meetings in the Executive Boardroom. The location of my room was not so great (511) which was right beside the vending/ice machines. The buzz from the machines were a little annoying when trying to sleep and the view did not allow much for natural light. Luckily the days were spent at the meetings. The room itself was nice and clean, so no complaints. The water pressure for the shower could have been better. Local calls made from your room were at a charge of $1.50 and internet at around $16.00 a day I believe. The gym was well equipped and clean. Hotel staff is helpful and friendly. The location was great since the Bloor Station subway stop was right next door, so it was convenient getting around to shop etc. Bloor Street shops just down the street as well. Longo's grocery store with a Starbucks in it was also really convenient and open till 10pm in case you wanted some late night snacks or just to pop over to grab lunch or dinner at their salad/deli bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: globalbouncer
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Marriott last weekend for 2 nights and was very pleased with the hotel and its location. The rooms are nicely decorated in warm golds and reds with nice photos of the Bloor-Yorkville area. The bed was very comfortable. We were able to adjust the temp. inside the room, which was great because like all hotel rooms, seemed a little warm and very dry. If your windows are facing the inside courtyard, it's not the nicest view- try to get a room that faces the city if possible. There is a Longo's grocery store right downstairs - with a Starbucks- handy for a cheap breakfast on the go. Also downstairs- foodcourt, the Bay, Shoppers, subway access, other small shops. Walking distance to cinema, shopping in Yorkville, Whole Foods, shopping on Bloor, Church St. village- AMAZING LOCATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DianeChayer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Bloor St from 4 to 8th Feb. I think this hotel is not the quality you should expect with Marriott. My room was too warm and it was not possible to adjust the temperature.The first evening, there was a fire alarm. They announced that we should stay in our room until further notice. It took 20 minutes before the notice of false alarm came. Then in the middle of the night, there were three people sitting on the floor a few meters from my door talking loud and laughing. The next day, there was a strong smell of paint in the corridor and in the rooms on my floor. They claimed it was coming from another building and offered me to move, but it is not really convenient to move in the middle of your stay. Maybe I was just unlucky, but that stay was not really relaxing! At least, the staff was friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Best value for a 4 star hotel in Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: rayz
Reviews.Content: Being an original Torontonian,( having lived there for 50 years) but now reside out of town I like to come back for an occasional visit. If your stay involves activities in "uptown" or " Toronto north" meaning Yonge/Bloor/BayAvenue /Sherbourne sts , you simply cannot beat the value offered by this hotel. Its not perfect by any means, but for what you pay its a bargain compared to any other hotel in the immediate area classified as a 4 star. The rooms are spacious. The mattresses are very comfortable with excellent quality linens and pillows. I opted for a suite upgrade for an extra $60 and it was worth every penny. Over 600 sq ft of living space with french doors separating a beautiful living room and the inviting bedroom. Mini fridge, Keurig coffee maker, 2 large flat screen tv's, and a nice sized bathroom with plenty of counter space. You can book this hotel through some internet sites and then opt for the upgrade as I did. Overall I paid $140 with breakfast included! Instead of the buffet I ordered room service which was on time and very good. PARKING> Ok.., from what I learned parking is at a premium anywhere in downtown Toronto. If you are parking here on the weekend, you simply have to enter throught the parking entrance to the Bay and hotel at the rear. I paid $10 for one night....not bad. I believe the rate changes during the week days. The staff are incredible here. They go all out to ensure your stay is an enjoyable one. Very friendly ,and helpful to answer all questions regarding points of interests and restaurants in the vicinity. Save your money and stay here. You will not be dissapointed. I stayed on the fifth floor and there are only 6 floors here. I always try to book as high as I can staying in a hotel as I find it quieter. Everything you need is close by including a 24 hour minimart right behind the hotel. Public transit is at your door. The Bellman is always ready and always polite. I will come back to this hotel. Thankyou Marriott Yorkville!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: alanps
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fine - nothing wrong with those but the breakfast was sub-par and the layout of the building means your walk to the room very long. Seems picky but its just an ok Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: smokeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for two nights while helping our daughter move to a new condo. Room was bright, large, clean and quiet. Excellent value for Toronto using AAA/CAA discount. Price included a full breakfast which was excellent. Service from everyone at the hotel was excellent, location great and overall a wonderful stay. My wife and I look forward to going back to this hotel and enjoy our time in Toronto, rather than spend the days moving boxes!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to spend the weekend with your sisters”
Reviews.Author: OttawaLovethesun
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Toronto on Jan 20/12 to spend a weekend with my 3 sisters and cousin for a fun girls weekend. We were very happy with the location of the hotel, close to shopping (underground) with wonderful restaurants nearby. We received an upgraded room that included a sitting area that was perfect for our group. All calls to the concierge and for room service were handled immediately and we always had service with a smile. I would defintely return to this hotel for a future stay in Toronto and have no complaints about the hotel whatsover.

Reviews.Title: “Restful stay”
Reviews.Author: fortitudeX4
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick, friendly and efficient. The room was spacious and clean - appeared to have been recently updated. I was in room 540 - it was very quiet except for the occasional humming from what I figured was the nearby elevator. The hotel is structured in an open square - so the rooms look into an exterior courtyard. Nice floor to ceiling windows across the room. The bathroom had black granite counters, Kohler faucets and wood accents. The bath/shower combo had a nice rainfall shower head, good water pressure and was spotless - tiles were actually gleaming! The room had a small bar fridge which was handy. There was a small cafe in the lobby that served Starbucks coffee and you could get a coffee "to go" for $2. I ordered room service for breakfast on this visit - and as I am allergic to certain fruit, I specified this on the menu, thinking I would be left with a banana...well to my great pleasure I was treated to a beautiful bowl of blueberries and strawberries along with my hot oatmeal. How wonderful. The service arrived in the time specified and my stay here was pretty much perfect. I checked out through the main desk as my breakfast charge did not appear on my invoice which was slid under the door in the morning. Check out was quick and very friendly. I was able to leave the hotel through an entrance in the main lobby that links directly with the TTC subway below. 6 short stops to Union Station. As a little sidebar - in one of the bedside tables, there was a very interesting little book that contained stories from Marriott employees. It was very interesting to learn of the beginnings of this company and how it expanded with a bit of insight from employees. Thank you Marriott Bloor Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Parking Situation”
Reviews.Author: LeicaMan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times, and the best part of this hotel is the location. Yonge and Bloor is arguably the main crossroads of Toronto and where the North/South and East/West subway intersects. A great starting point for walking and ease of Public transport. I agree with the reviewer who questions the wisdom of charging for Internet. Time to change that. Staff in the breakfast and bar area were very friendly. I still don't know why people opt for the breakfast buffet when you can order fresh off the menu. Has anyone really ever had a "fresh and hot" meal of eggs, bacon and home-fries from a buffet? The biggest challenge was the parking. 24 hour Valet parking is $35 (plus tip every-time they park and retrieve the car), and the alternatives are few and far between. There is an outdoor lot across the street and to the left that charges $10 flat rate from 6pm to 6am and another indoor lot on Charles Street, two blocks over that is a bit less. When you're here to relax and enjoy yourself, the last thing you need is to stress out over parking rates, and I'm sure the hotel knows this, so in most cases just add $40 a day to the room charges if your driving.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, well ...”
Reviews.Author: BLA07
Reviews.Content: This is not my first visit to the Marriott Bloor Yorkville. The location of the hotel is why I have selected it in past and why I selected it again this time. I'm not sure that I was expecting a lot of change in the hotel and I wasn't disappointed -- nothing has changed since my last stay three years ago. The price is good; the location is what I wanted; the rooms are large and well appointed. However, given everything, I can only give the hotel an Average. Here's why: The internet is only free in the lobby. I still can't understand why hotels do not have free internet -- build it into the cost of the room. Towel are a three on a scale of five. Not thread-bare but not fluffy either. Bed is fairly comfortable but not pillow-topped mattress. Again, just a three. I had such a bad experience with breakfast the last time I stayed at this Marriott, I didn't even give it a chance this time. Thus, no "scrambled egg" test. I walked over to Flo's Diner for breakfast. Water pressure in the shower is "just OK". Having said all of this, I probably will stay here again. But, I sure wish they would change their policy on internet availability.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: roaddogg1983
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were in Toronto for a Phillies game and to experience the city for a weekend. This hotel has large rooms and appears relatively new. When traveling, I like to stay in Marriott hotels if I can. I would say this is a good Marriott hotel, but it is not the best Marriott hotel I have stayed in. The location was ok in relation to the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel almost weekly since August of 2011 and have never been disappointed. The hotel staff, especially the front desk and Consignerâ€™s Lounge staff, provides timely and effective service. The staff is always pleasant and more than willing to help. The Hotel itself is clean and reasonably well kept. The subway is available directly underground to the hotel as is a shopping plaza complete with food court. There a several excellent restaurants within walking distance and for those adventurous souls Yonge St is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Mid town convenience”
Reviews.Author: sunnyboy9
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the super convenience of this Bloor Yorkville property. Right next door is an extensive indoor walkways that connect to the entire Bloor Yorkville area. In winter months, we really appreciated the warm walkways lined with food, shops and service outlets.Grab a coffee and doughnut on the go, drop off some laundry, top up your phone plan, get a massage, send flowers? Right there! The best is that the entrance of Marriott is 30 paces from one of the Bloor Yonge subway entrances. bingo, you go everywhere on the TTC system. With all these, we could put up a bit with the less than luxurious decor: the room is large sized, the gym outstanding and yes, even Matisse, the breakfast place downstairs is pretty good for a catchup place for coffee with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: zorro514
Reviews.Content: Adequate service, good location, but that's about it. Certainly no flagship among Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mwar1004
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience. I also stayed at another property in Toronto on the same trip that was supposed to be better, but it wasn't. I thought the service was very particular and I can appreciate that. This hotel is also in a very trendy part of town away from most of the hussle and bustle. I would suggest you stay at this hotel and I will try to stay here anytime I am in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: dureid
Reviews.Content: spacious rooms good rates and excellent location people are nice and communicate well breakfast is reasonable but the best is the room and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: strawberryshtc
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto with my boyfriend for my 30th birthday. I have zero complaints. It was close enough to the airport, the taxi ride was 60 bucks. Its very close to the subway, lots of restaurants and shopping. I enjoyed taking like a 8 dollar cab ride to the eaton center, which is like this awesome shopping and eating destination. I has some really awesome food while in Toronto, one of the best things I had I found right outside the hotel. There is a food cart right on the corner it it sells the best polish sausage ever! Im from chicago where hot dogs and sausage are big. So when I say it was sooo good, I mean it. The Marriot on Bloor had very nice employees they were helpful, when needed. My room was amazing! It was huge, clean ,comfortable, the complimentary robes were great. I would without a question stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: this is a typical marriott, but the location is unbeatable. the hotel is located adjacent to a subway station that brings you directly to the end station where u then transfer to the bus to get to the airport (remember to get your free transfer ticket for the bus later once u passed the subway entry at your starting point. coming form the airport, take the transfer ticket from the driver when you board the bus after paying your fare in exact coins). there's also a supermarket when you turn left from the hotel entrance where one can get water and other stuffs. my room had two queen size beds and were relatively spacious and clean. however, the doors and wall are not that soundproof and you can hear doors slamming at times at night. i also realized that this is the second marriott property i had stayed in without a 'do not disturb' tag to hang on my door, and that clearly invited housekeeping to knock on my door very early. bathroom was clean and spacious with clean rain-forest shower head which I found to lack in pressure. nonetheless, i'm grateful that the showerhead is clean unlike other a certain hyatt in montreal i had stayed at where it was gross and mouldy. the gym was surprisingly huge and well equipped. the only downside was the lack of free internet in the rooms though you can get it for free at the lobby. there are also not much places to eat around this area as it is largely a commercial and financial district so dinner may be a problem. the subways also do not run 24/7 like here in new york so if you are someone who stays out late, get another hotel hear a 24hour bus line or streetcar line. if you can get the hotel at an affordable rate, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mathx
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a delegation of 8 from India and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel that you spend through your jet lag usually doesnt get good reviews but this was a good place. Rooms were decent ( though I did find lighting a bit low) bathrooms decent sized and comfortable beds. I had a few vegetarians in my group and we checked in by 8 pm on arrival. Check in process was smooth and everyone had their room keys in less than 5 minutes which was impressive. The restaurant was closed by the time we all freshened up and came down, so we ended up having to order dinner at the bar. The waiter was really kind and managed a group of 10 walking in near to closing time very well including a few with dietary restrictions.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sw224
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much improved since my last visit. As always, there are long winding hallways to get to your room so if you have trouble walking ask for one close to the elevator. The room was very clean and big and a large laptop sized safe (big enough for a 15 inch) is provided in room. The gym here is fantastic and not too minimalist. For those who do strength exercises, they have a large set of free weights and a few machines. For those who do aerobics, there are a bunch of bikes, treadmills and elliptical machines. Definitely a good place to stay if you're on a fitness regime since some hotel gyms don't have free weights. Also it's open 24 hours! For those who have allergies, the hallways can be quite musty however the individual room I stayed in did not have any smell and the sheets are hypoallergenic. Overall, a good hotel with polite service and an excellent location. Unfortunately however, I can only give this a 3/5 rating since I did not feel it met the 4 star rating it is listed as, it feels more of a 3 or 3 1/2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do worse”
Reviews.Author: halifaxborn
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at this Marriott because it was the designated hotel for a conference I was attending. Very reasonable room rate because of the conference booking. Room was spacious, but I had trouble getting enough air and a comfortable temperature. Highly irritating bathroom door that could not be propped open. Lovely wide showerhead. Clock radio did not work; fortunately the "guest services" folk will do wake-up calls. In-room internet comes with a hefty extra charge, and the price of the so-so buffet breakfast will knock your socks off. First time I have seen a hotel offer a reward ($5 voucher) for guests who "decline" housekeeping services -- who really needs the bed made in a hotel room? Most important asset of this Marriott is the location, right above the Bloor-Yonge subway station.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely change!”
Reviews.Author: hamilton44
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at 4 star hotels near Queen/University avenue to be close to the Four Seasons Centre but on this occasion our Hotwire booking led us to the Marriott in Yorkville. What a great experience! Lovely large room with very comfortable king bed overlooking a nice garden. Right above underground shopping mall with access to the Bay and Holt Renfrew and right above the subway. (and so it only took about 15 minutes to get to the Four Seasons Centre). Very convenient - and an added bonus is the LCBO right underneath the hotel where you can get a nice bottle of wine. Short walking distance to very good Yorkville restaurants and to Pusateri's (high end deli). We really enjoy a quiet room and were getting fed up with revellers returning to their rooms around 3 a.m. which happens quite often with hotels near the entertainment district. This hotel was much quieter. Strongly recommended. There is a problem with the trip advisor site - this hotel did not have a swimming pool but I cannot show that in the review...please disregard the rating for the pool...there isn't one!

Reviews.Title: “Typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: bidnowbaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, October 2011 Priceline bid/win of $125/night...came to $150/night with taxes Priceline calls this 4stars...I say more like 3stars Pros: Location VERY close to subway stop Bathroom fixtures/finishes very nice Bath and Body Works brand toiletries Plenty of towels Good room size Safe in room Room and bathroom very clean, tub was perfectly white. Good h20 pressure. Bed and pillows very comfy Parking in Hudson Bay garage around corner was only $11/day (did this by accident!) Cons: Generic design Hallways could use updating...wall sconces very dated; ugly carpeting No great lobby No free internet access in rooms (knew that going in...) No view from room (my room at least!) and FILTHY window made it appear dark/dreary Circular design...get off elevator and walk down hall and turn, turn again, turn again, etc. Weak hairdryer Overall: Would stay again for this price but wouldn't pay more than $125/night

Reviews.Title: “Typical standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferRose8
Reviews.Content: Very typical hotel, nothing special. Rooms are good size, yet mediocre in design & amenities. Circular floor layout, make for a long walk to some rooms. I stayed for a week for a business trip, we hosted our annual Sales Meeting here. The meeting rooms were nice, the service was excellent - the business concierge, the av team, the food services; would definitely recommend for business activities. The front desk and restaurant/bar were kind but to the point. A big complaint...twice during my 6 night stay we were awoken by the fire alarm and evacuation. Come to find out it was the Bunsen burners being used by the hotel staff to heat breakfast in the 4th floor corridor for another meeting. No explanations, no apologies - NOT good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “reception and stay”
Reviews.Author: mapleconsultants
Reviews.Content: Hi, I would like to thank Mr. Mark Manager of the hotel, who took care of the delegates came from India for the conference here in Toronto. Very well organized and the staffs are very kind of course the hotel is well maintained. Thank you very much sudarshan Faculty Bio-medical Engg Centennial College. Toronto

Reviews.Title: “A slightly old, full service Marriott that feels a little worn”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two days on business this week. I didnâ€™t handle the booking myself it was handled by the company whoâ€™s function I was attending. I did however call the property ahead on the day of my stay to advise them of my Marriott Platinum Elite status and was assured that they had made a note of it. Two very simple things I like â€“ a HIGH floor and extra pillows â€“ which are both in my profile. Needless to say on check in at 1:00am â€“ I got neither! I was allocated a 2nd floor of a 6 Floor property, and the room was located about half a block walk from the elevators. Thats what I remembered about my last stay there, the never ending walk to the room! I have stayed here before, and it is not my hotel of choice in Toronto. On arrival there was no one t assist with luggage and car valet was not to be found. For $35.00 per night I expect a car valet to be there and at least a doorman to greet you and assist on arrival! Especially at 1:00am â€“ I mean it wasnâ€™t rush hour! I had to return to front desk after my check in to drop car keys! After complaining to the GM the next day about the valet situation â€“ that was in fact swiftly addressed and my reservation was obviously flagged and I didnâ€™t have any more issues with the valet. Valet parking is $35/day â€“ they donâ€™t tell you about the Self parking which is available below the building for $17/day! I felt the least that they could do was to waive the parking fee for the first night!â€¨ I don't consider this a luxury property. It has the standard features of a slightly old, full service Marriott and feels a little worn. The Concierge lounge is truly mediocre, with equally mediocre offerings. I was quite surprised as management informed me the hotel was over sold, but certainly the Concierge lounge [located on 6th floor] was not busy any of the peak times I went there. Lobby is functional but certainly not opulent and you definitely know you are not in the best hotel in town. The hotel is in fact very ordinary. It does have a great convenient location. The rooms are quite plain, but I had a large room, I wouldnâ€™t describe it as the best view â€“ looking straight into another building and when I have stayed before I had equally depressing views. A lot of the rooms have a view of the interior courtyard. Room was however very comfortable and functional -- Great bed and â€˜OKâ€™ bathroom, a nice size desk, flat screen LCD TV. One thing I had never seen before anywhere is was a card advising that you can decline housekeeper service for some Marriott points - certainly I would not do this and find nothing worse than arriving back at my hotel room to a room that has not been cleaned. In fact the next day after leaving at 9am â€“ my room was not cleaned until 2:30pm! Some positives: - hotel has a good location and a fair price - direct connection to the shopping centre and self-park - The subway is just downstairs - There was also a small, but good market beside the Marriott . No swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Marriot on Bloor”
Reviews.Author: JamesHAfrica
Reviews.Content: An immensely convenient hotel that I use at least once a year. Rooms are comfortably average but the staff outperform in every respect, helpful, enthusiastic and proud of their home city. Bar prices are a little high but the asian salad a welcome healthy option when traveling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and location!”
Reviews.Author: NOTLFan925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend in Toronto, August 5-8, and had a wonderful stay at this Marriott. We had a package that included breakfast each day. Our room was always clean and extremely comfortable. There were many groups at the hotel, but we had no noise in the hallways. The buffet breakfast was excellent with all of the food presented beautifully and at the proper temperature. The selection was varied enough that we did not have a lot of repitition for the days we were there. The location in Yorkville was within walking distance to numerous shops and dining options. The stores were mostly upscale in the items and prices offered, but the window shopping was fun as well! The dining options offered were varied as well with any kind of cuisine you can imagine being offered. A special note--please take advantage of the concierge service offered in the hotel lobby! Angie is fabulous in her help and recommendations. She has contacts everywhere it seems and goes beyond the extra mile to see that you are accomodated. Will definitely stay here when visiting Toronto again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: WanderingSusan123
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of days at this hotel on business. The room was comfortable and clean, though nothing special. I think the location was very central, though the office I was traveling to was rather far out. The hotel restaurant was very friendly, though the menu and decor are a bit uninspired or dated. The service was great, and I felt very welcomed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: RDPMontreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to many wonderful restaurants, very charming neighborhood. The room was very spacious, the bed was comfortable and the service was excellent. I was able to find parking right across the street (not inexpensive but very close).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for shopping an excellent Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: NyssaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a large room wtih two double beds. Hotels staff was friendly and rooms were very clean. The location is ideal for shopping and Restaurants on Cumberland Street are very good, pricey but well worth it. The only inconveniene is the parking. Situated in another complex and to access it you need to exit the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great for weekend”
Reviews.Author: speechless082
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed rooms, parking is difficult as you must driveto back of the hotel, and there are many one way streets. No pool. Gym with good equipment. No newspaper. Only one restaurant. Good concierge and front desk service. Valet parking is expensive. No small touches like chocolates on your pillow. Windows on the outside were dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniorOttawa
Reviews.Content: 4 gals stayed here in a room with two queen beds, was very comfortable, plenty of room for a short stay. Clean, good beds, quiet, indoor parking. In-room Coffee was awful. Excellent location for visiting downtown Toronto, subway a few steps away, close to interesting Yorkville and Bloor Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk service and good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: patch4750
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before flying out to Montreal and after we had already stayed in a noisy condo on the outer city limits. So we were looking for a bit of pampering and the suite with separate bedroom did not disappoint. Peaceful, comfortable bed was excellent. The proximity to upmarket shopping and plenty of restaurants in nearby Yorkville makes this a good place to stay. Also particularly handy is the AVIS rental garage in the same building. Front desk staff on checkin were very helpful finding us the right room. Only worrying thing is what seems to be an epidemic in Many North American hotels...most are "pet friendly". It's hard to stop yourself wondering what kind of animal has been in the room before you! Especially when you hear the occasional "yap yap" from the room across the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! and Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: pidell
Reviews.Content: In needed a nice hote lto stay at in the downtown Toronto area, while visiting friends. I usually prefer Marriott as they have always been a trusted hotel, that exceeds the service I look for in a hotel. The hotel is situated in a nice area in the Yorkville subdivision right off of Bloor Street. You have the fine shopping at your finger tips right up the street, which was beyond convenient. The Eaton Centre, CN Tower, and all the nice major attractions are all within distance, which made this hotel very suitable for me. When entering upon the hotel, the staff was nothing but friendly and inviting awaiting to assist you. The lobby had been renovated not too long ago, and looked rather lovely as did the guest rooms. The beds were super relaxing and comfortable and provided a good nights rest during my entire stay. I did have the opportunity to see how their room service was, and everything was perfect. The restaurant Matissa in the Hotel was priced a pinch cheaper then the hotels room service, as the food was delicious. I went there almost daily for a bowl of the soup of the day. Cannot wait for my return back to Toronto to visit my friends, as I will be making this officially hotel of choice each time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very friendly and room was very clean”
Reviews.Author: Lafea
Reviews.Content: Near many amenities. Central, easy to take taxis. Good restaurant. Everything we needed. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but nothing Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorPaul
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville is definitely in a very good location within Toronto. In the heart of the city and close to many of what Toronto offers. Getting to the hotel can be challenging at the wrong time of day due to horrible traffic near the airport. The hotel seems to have been renovated recently and the rooms reflect the newest Marriott standards. Room was clean and the latest technology was installed (i.e. Flat Screen TV). The bathroom was clean and updated. When I arrived at the hotel about 3 pm, there were no rooms available, so I had to go to the business center and did some work while I waited for a hotel to be ready. They gave me a nice end room which was far away from the elevator and was in a quiet section of the hotel. One thing that was disappointing is that the hotel did not contain a swimming pool. This was a surprise for a Marriott and considering its location and its hotel class. Although my stay was pleasant and trouble free, I will most likely not come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MaylandAndrea
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in great area. Metro in basement, nice market next door and across the street from a good all-day breakfast place. Seemed extremely safe to walk around. Very close to high end shopping and good restaurants. Ate one "appetizer" meal in restaurant. Good, not great. "Jenny' the concierge was extremely helpful -- even walking us out the door to give us directions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: honeykissed
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at this hotel to stay in after birthday festivities in Yorkville. From the very beginning the service was amazing! They pick the best of the best when hiring for their front desk because those ladies were the best concierge staff I had ever met. I had booked with Mariott Rewards which got me a discounted rate (only $126/room since it was a Summer weekend!) and even though it was one of the cheapest rates, I had requested 2 queen beds in each room (which didn't actually come with the room rate we were paying since only 2 double beds were included) but they still gave it to us. Usually when you make special requests at the time of booking (like extra towels or extra pillows) most hotels don't cater to those requests but the Marriott gave everything I requested. I asked for extra towels and extra foam pillows and all were in the rooms at check in. On top of that, the rooms were beautiful! Modern and spacious with comfortable beds. I had also mentioned to the lady at the front desk that it was my birthday since she asked what brought us to the hotel and a few hours into our stay someone brought up a platter of crackers, cheese & fruit with a birthday card attached! Talk about service, no hotel would ever go out of their way to make that extra effort to make their guests feel that special. When we got back from the partying (around 3am) we asked the concierge what time check out was and she said since we were coming back so late from partying she'll let us check out at 1pm instead of 11am free! She didn't even take down our room number so I assume this is a service they provide all guests which I personally find amazing because the one thing I dislike about going to hotels is that I need to wake up at a certain time to check out by 11am (which usually is too early for my liking). To top it all off, when we were walking out of the hotel at 1pm on Sunday the lady who checked us in said "Happy Birthday Ms. Thomas, have an amazing day!". She remembered my name and that it was my birthday! They have hundreds of guests check in everyday and yet she remembered my name! It blew my mind that service could be THAT good at a hotel. The Toronto Marriott Bloor-Yorkville has officially become my all time favourite hotel. It's walking distance to pretty much everything downtown. The service is exceptional and the rooms are beautiful. I'm definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services and people working there are very nice and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Qiong D
Reviews.Content: My Spanish friend and I stayed in this hotel for two nights (Aug. 14 and 15, 2011). It's the first time that my friend came to Canada. She couldn't speak English and my spoken English is so so. We were very impressed with the excellent services this hotel provided. A couple of examples, We were not familiar to Toronto at all. We wanted to take the subway. After we asked a lady working in the lobby of the main entrance that hotel, she was so nice to accompany us to the subway station connected to the hotel. Farahna, a very nice girl who was working in the front desk of that hotel, was so kind to provide all the info about the "City tour" we were interested in and booked it for us. Even a very nice man working in the housekeeping department of the hotel did help me a lot when I saw him in the hallway of the floor and asked him a few questions about Toronto. Itâ€™s hard for a tourist in a city like Toronto that he or she is not familiar with at all. A help, even if itâ€™s a trivial one, can make a big difference. My friend and I had a wonderful time and unforgettable memory about the hotel. We will come back and would like to recommend it to our friends and relatives. Thanks a lot. Qiong Dai

Reviews.Title: “Worried for no reason - Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieBlue
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at this hotel for three nights (Thurs-Sunday) and despite some less than stellar reviews, we have nothing but good to say about this hotel. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and pleasant (even going so far as to look around for ice cream places that were open late one night). The concierge was extremely friendly and also very, very helpful. She helped us to find family-friendly restaurants and helped us to navigate the subway with ease. All of the other staff we encountered were equally cheerful and pleasant - right down to the gentleman who brought us extra pillows and blankets. I think in many cases, you get what you give in regards to treatment from others. The rooms were larger than I anticipated for a big city. They were immaculate and very comfortable. Bath & Body works toiletries were a nice touch as well. One thing that would have been helpful to know in advance is that you cannot get a roll-away bed in a room with two queens. I wish I had known this prior to check-in. However, my youngest is 4 1/2 and we made a "bed" by pushing the two chairs in the room together. He fit well, was comfortable and thought it was "cool", thankfully. The hotel was quiet at night - no slamming doors, no noise from other rooms, just the faint sound of the subway passing below (which no one else noticed, until I was nice enough to point it out). There is no pool in this hotel. However, with so much to do nearby, we never missed it. I also was pleased that the hotel was never crowded feeling or super busy, even during our weekend stay. The area that the hotel is located in is wonderful. It is very clean, safe and filled with everything you could want nearby - the subway entrance is next door, a market across the street, plentiful restaurants (high-end to fast food) and a short walk to a charming neighborhood where we enjoyed handmade ice cream (Summer's Sweet Memories) later one evening. The hotel is also within easy walking distance to the Royal Ontario Museum. I questioned whether this museum would be interesting to three young boys, but let me tell you, do not miss it. We spent the entire day on the second floor. As an adult, I would love to go back to Toronto, just to visit the rest of the museum again. As for parking, use the public lot on Asquith street, just behind the hotel. Unless you plan on lots of coming and going in your car (which is completely unnecessary in Toronto), it's much less expensive than using the hotel valet. Also, be sure to check the rack near the concierge for coupons for many of the area attractions. You'll be happy to save some money after buying food in this city. We had a wonderful stay at this Marriott and I would certainly recommend it and stay here again. Friendly staff, comfortable beds, larger than expected rooms, affordable, and a GREAT location....

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices in TO”
Reviews.Author: the_d_duo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. Billing itself as a 4* property is, in my view, misleading. Why? The rooms are fine - the difference is very poor customer service. When I went to check in, I was told there were no rooms available. After the two people in line after me were able to get rooms, my argument with the desk manager managed to secure me a key. On check out, there were a series of charges for valet parking on my bill which were reversed but only after a number of phone calls to somewhere... Most of the rooms have a view of the interior "courtyard" with a view of the garbage strewn roof of the lobby of the hotel. Note that there is no on-site parking. Valet parking is a rip-off, you can drive the 1/2 block yourself for more than half the price. If you are pressed or get a great deal, it is fine - just don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “everything you expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: G4CHP
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and well placed for some areas of Toronto. Convenient parking with reasonable self parking charges.

Reviews.Title: “customer services is annoying!”
Reviews.Author: momopi
Reviews.Content: i'm staying for this hotel for a business trip, and just now, the fire system alarmed. so i call the customer service if we will go out. she said no, and wait for the announcement. then the security personnel said that the fire alarm system was on and now under investigation, but the fire alarm was still on. so, i call again the customer service and ask if that was a fire drill, and she said with an angry voice (she is not shouting but you can feel that she was irritated) "didn't you hear the announcement? what does it said?" i just said to her that i did not hear anything what we should do. then she just said that i should stay on my room. i understand that she feel irritated maybe because a lot of people is calling them and asking them what to do, but still, I am the customer, and i only want my safety. she should still answer me in a good manner and assuring me that everything is under control and not to worry. how rude this people can be!!!

Reviews.Title: “I am still itching!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaXxxxxx
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at the Marriott on Bloor. I booked through Priceline and got a good deal for a spectacularly located hotel. The valet was fantastic as was the staff checking in. The entire process was smooth and easy. When I arrived in the room it was clean but seemed a little dated, which was no big deal. I did find a very unappealing hair in the sink but that is an easy thing for a cleaner to miss. The stay was completely uneventful until I woke up the next morning to find a row of what appeared to be mosquito bites on my forehead. They were very itchy and took almost two weeks to disappear. When I had them checked I was advised they were bed bug bites. My initial inclination was to say nothing but was compelled to contact the hotel by a friend. To that end, I sent an e-mail to Marriott and received a response advising that my complaint would be forwarded to the hotel manager who would contact me. A week later and I still haven't had any response. To think that the manager of a large and very well know hotel would ignore a customer who had experienced beg bug bites is amazing. Every time I think of that night I am inclined to itchâ€¦..sorry I had to stop typing to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay: Daily fire alarms and one power cut...”
Reviews.Author: Discerning1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a suite for 3 nights from August 10. Shortly after arriving early evening the fire alarm went off meaning we had to walk down 10 floors to reception and wait until given the all clear after the Toronto Fire Dept had inspected and found nothing. The following late afternoon, the same thing happened. On Friday morning there was a power cut which lasted from 0730hrs until sometime after 1145hrs (when we left the hotel for the day having had to use the bathroom by torchlight to get ready for the day). Again, we had to walk down 10 floors to exit the hotel. On Saturday morning, whilst preparing to check out, the fire alarm went off again at approximately 1100hrs. The building was evacuated, the Toronto Fire Dept turned up and again the all clear was given some time later. When we raised these issues with the manager, we were told that people had been smoking in the stairwell and therefore they were not false alarms and we were offered 5,000 Marriott points and the extra charge for our kid's rollaway bed was removed from the bill! Not good enough Marriott...this hotel is a disgrace to the brand and you need to do better. Secondary to this: the room was fine, housekeeping was good (and their job was made especially difficult by the constant disruption) but could not be sure as to the true nature of the view out towards Bloor as the windows were so filthy. Would not stay here again and do not recommend for reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: sheila2341
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT...The subway is the only way to travel..This was the first time for all of us using the subway,and it was great.The people in the subway would direct you to the proper platform to where ever we wanted to go, so simple when you ask..and cheap.The subway is right under the hotel. We went there for a concert and blue jays game.There is a market right beside the hotel with everything you can imagine and fresh. Tim Hortons around the corner or up the street. Shopping and restaurants all with in walking distance..Hemmingsway restaurant is a 10 minute walk, and has 3 outdoor rooftop patios, service and food was great and good pricing.This hotel came recommended by Lisa from the Marriott in Sudbury and everything was well above our expectations.The rooms are huge and so comfortable and clean. ALL the staff are super friendly and go above and beyond every request or questions. Zlata, Diogo and Ashley were super people and made our stay even more fun. I would highly recommend this hotel.When I go back to Toronto I will stay there again. Thanks for the fun time. Sheila from Sudbury

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sheriff64
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff and management attitude not even good enough for a one star hotel. Rude and unwelcomming, and did not honour my reservation even though I gave them my credit card number when I did reservation online to guarantee my reservation. They did not even attempt to fix the problem or offer alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: KerrDawn
Reviews.Content: Over the course of the last 7 months, I spent 29+ weeks in residence at the Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville Hotel. I can say without hesitation that it is the best service that I have received while staying in a hotel across the globe. The accomodations are wonderful, but the staff are superb. Starting with the front desk, you will be greeted by friendly, caring staff who will make every effort to ensure your accomodations are perfect. They are more than helpful in recommending restaurants, shopping, as well as any activities that you might wish to enjoy. The front desk is up-to-date on events occurring within the city, both current and upcoming. Please give Tamara, Sergio, Carol and all of the other staff my warm regards when you stay. For those who have access to the Concierge Lounge, you MUST meet George. He is one of the crown jewels of this hotel. George oversees the lounge in the evenings and maintains a clean, friendly environment with delicious appetizers (actually, you could make a meal off the appetizers). He was quick to enquire about my day, and then truly listened when it was "one of those days". The Bell Captain and staff are also fantastic. Victor will double-check to make certain that all of your luggage arrives safely from your mode of transportation to the lobby, as well as when you leave back safely into your taxi/limo. All of the staff are courteous, professional, and provide that "at home" feeling. I would strongly recommend this hotel and when I next travel to Toronto, this will be the hotel of my choice.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed platinum member”
Reviews.Author: chinz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-end at the Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville Hotel. The property is well located and the rooms are clean. However, the hotel management team is very dissappointing. There was a problem with the bathroom door not staying open which caused me to slam my head into the side of the door. The management saw this door problem and said it would be reported but felt this accident was acceptable. I suffered headaches and pain which made for a very poor two day relaxing vacation. In addition, the fire alarm went off at 3 am as it has done many times before in this hotel. We do not recommend staying here!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, will be back”
Reviews.Author: jeter241
Reviews.Content: Great location, service very good, food excellent and well priced

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Happytogetaway_10
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at the Marriott Bloor Yorkville Hotel (Wedding June 18th) for an overnight. This hotel is clean and service is great. The rooms are nice. IThe beds are very, very comfortable. The location is excellent for shopping and dining. I would stay again and would recommend, No problem

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mck_krg
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. King bed was extremely comfortable with a selection of both soft and hard pillows. Room was spacious and immaculate, staff was always helpful with directions and service. Room service was very prompt. Also extremely important, the location is very central (Bloor & Yonge), subway is right downstairs, as well as a small mall. This hotel is walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and there is a grocery store right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, good location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessOscar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Fire alarm went off after midnight, everyone had to evacuate. This is not an uncommon occurrence for this hotel. Read the previous posts from Trip members. But the hotel was comfy, great beds/linens, very clean, and roomy. THere is a grocery store adjacent to the hotel which was very convenient. I had a microwave and fridge brought to my room for the week. Shower pressure was great, very important to me. Cleaning staff could be a little more diligent about ensuring the coffee supplies were restocked each day, but that is the only complaint. Mink Mile is located on this street, so if you are in to high end shopping, this is the place to stay. However, if you have money to spend at the Mink Mile, you are probably staying is a better hotel! The court yard is pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds-not so quiet room”
Reviews.Author: lmhl1990
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Bloor Yorkville while attending a conference. Check in process was quick and easy. Front desk staff was helpful. The rooms were large and very clean. The bed was great, although the room was noisy. It was as if there was a mechanical/boiler/laundry room on the other side of the wall by the head of the bed. The sound of the fans and thumping could be heard all night. Requested a late check out, but it was not available due as the hotel was booked to capacity. Overall, good experience, would stay again. 20minute walk to Eaton Centre. The self parking at the hotel is difficult to find as it has poor signage.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bubbavon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on 24 flight layover. We got ther room for $65 taxes incl. through priceline. The room was huge. It had no tub only a shower but tother than was very large with a King size bed, safe, in room coffee and large flat screen tv. Only downside is even thou I am a Marriots rewards person I could not get free internet in the room because i booked on priceline. Staff was exceptional. On departing I thought I had misplaced my passport. Not a good thing when the car they ordered is waiting and you need to catch an overseas flight. They helped keep me calm and three people helped me look. We found it where it should have been but their patience and calm was greatly appreciated. I do not know his name but the bellman was excellent not just in this instance but on each interaction. At regular price this hotel is very good and if you get a room through priceline it is a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: friendlyinsomniac
Reviews.Content: Nice renovated Marriott in heart of Toronto. Stayed 3 nights. One morning the breakfast buffet was overwhelmed, but the staff was very apologetic and eventually took care of everything. The other two days breakfast service was impeccable. Final night there my neighbor was watching television very loud past 2am, I had to use my white noise machine and ear plugs to overcome their inconsideration. The other two nights were very quiet. Comfy bed. Good climate control (mercifully with readings in fahrenheit!) Room and bathroom both quiet large and good closet. Location ideal for exploring downtown Toronto, direct access to two subway lines from the building.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_dude13
Reviews.Content: The room was very, very nice. Just like in the hotel website pictures; only, even better in person. It was spectacularly clean, and everything looked like it had never been used. The hotel must have undergone renovations recently. It was a spacious room, and high-quality and large television with many channels in HD. There was free coffee/maker in the room which has been disappearing lately from many hotels, so I was very pleased to see that. And a fridge was available upon request. The only downside to the room - it was kinda dark because it faced an inner courtyard. I was in the 'cheap' rooms, I guess. You could probably pay more for an upgrade, but for my rate I was thrilled with what I got. I'm so glad that many hotels are no longer gouging customers. The internet wasn't free, but it was a reasonable price ($13.60), and this hotel only charged taxes and a 15% service fee (gratuity) for room service. (In recent years, hotels had been charging an additional $4 delivery fee for room service, and then having a space for a tip in addition to the service fee which made room service way too expensive). They didn't have a space for tip on the room service bill because they already included it which I really liked. At the Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville, room service was very affordable!?!? I'm still in shock. The gym also had no views/not even a window if I recall correctly, but it was decent (very clean and new equipment). Next to the gym, there was also a coin-operated laundry. It's also a great location; just off Younge Street, and a subway stop right next door. Lots of stores, and restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, just lacking personality”
Reviews.Author: LONDONBANDD
Reviews.Content: Literally above the metro and right on Bloor (the Bond street of Toronto) the location is very good. The bed is very comfy and massive, room is nice but nothing special. Restaurant had great service but only average food. Get the internet and breakfast included for about 4 bucks, well worth it. A good place if you're not going to be spending much time there, or to hold a convention at.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Coming To This Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: SundayRose
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline cause we were stopping for just a night in Toronto before heading out to Niagara Falls the next morning. Thinking that we can get a good night's sleep here as we arrive only at night. Upon arrival by car, we saw a doorman who just stood there and stared at us... we were travelling with 2 young children and a helping hand would be great but instead the doorman was more like a lamp-post... just stand there! The floorplan of the rooms is like a maze.... we had to walk quite a bit around the buidling to get to the room. Because of the design, the walls were thin and not sound-proof... get what I mean?? We can hear people closing & opening doors... hear them talking... hear them using the tap.... sighh... After my kids went to sleep.... hardly an hour later, there was this FIRE-ALARM that went off!!! It was a slow beat alarm, meaning it's just a warning. But it went on for more than 15 mintues before any announcement was made to thru the PA system. People were coming out of their rooms and talking loudly... wondering to evacuate or not, people slamming doors, etc... At last when the announcement came, they told us it's under investigation... So in total it took more than 20 mins for this whole drama. Not good when you have 2 cranky & sleepy kids, was someone toying around with the system? It announced that the alarm was triggered from the 20-something floor... but the hotel just had less than 10 floors. Huh??? what the... Why took so long to announce the cause? It could have prevented people from slamming doors or talking loudly outside the hallway. Alarms are good for the protection of the people... but this system is weird. A few days later when we came back from Niagara and were shopping along Bloor street, we saw firetrucks outside this hotel again!!! Whoaa... another false alarm?? come on! I complained about the lack & slowness of the announcement to the Hotel Mgr the next morning and he was also not friendly.... he didn't give me a "customer-friendly" answer or respond in the way that I'm used to when I stay at hotels that has an international brand. If this guy worked in any hotel in Asia, he would have been fired already?? Lacks hospitality and the soft-touch in dealing with disgrunted customers. I won't stay here again... and I'm not recommending this hotel to you

Reviews.Title: “6 Thumbs up (3 people) for the Marriott Bloor Yorkville !!”
Reviews.Author: PeltzNH
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Toronto with my mom and sister. It was a sentimental journey to the city where my parents met and were married. This weekend would have been my parents 50th wedding anniversary. The hotel was just perfect for our needs and I would highly recommend it. It is located in a very stylish, safe part of the city - in walking distance to museums and higher end stores (though we are not shoppers.) You can also access the subway through the lower level without having to go outside which was nice on the rainy days. There is also an underground shopping mall on that level. We arrived on Thursday evening and checked out on Sunday. We stayed on the concierge level in two of the executive suites and they were fantastic - very roomy, stylish, comfortable and clean. There were refrigerators and safes in the rooms. The beds were very comfortable. We had a late supper in Matisse and it was very tasty. I highly recommend the very tasty Mezze Dip appetizer. We also had breakfast in the restaurant and the buffet was generously supplied with a good assortment, including very heathful choices. I used the gym several times and it was much larger than many hotel gyms I've used before. It didn't have a pool, but I was looking for cardio and weight equipment, so that didn't matter to me. I like that Marriotts supply free throw away (if you want) headphones for people who forget to bring their own along. The staff was very friendly and accommodating from the valet and front desk to the housekeeping and restaurant staff. I decided to self park our rental car since we weren't going to be using it again until departure. The cost per day for valet parking (which gives you unlimited in and out access to the car) was $35. Self parking was $22 per day during the weekdays and then dropped to $15 per day for the weekends. Anyway, the valet was kind enough to let me follow him while he parked another car so I would know exactly where to park. I thought this was very nice, since the hotel wasn't going to be receiving the parking income from us. I would recommend asking about adding a breakfast package on to your hotel rate. It added $15 per person to the room rate. If you buy the buffet separately I believe it is $17.95 per person. Tip - There is a Longos supermarket next door to buy fruit, snacks and other foods if you want to make a picnic or have snacks for the room. Final Tip - We decided to fly into Buffalo, NY and rent a car and drive over the border. It saved us about $600 by doing this (3 people). It also gave us the chance to stop by Niagra Falls and a couple of vineyards along the way (and there are copious vineyards in the area). We did learn after the fact about Porter Airlines who flies prop planes out of the small airport in the city. They fly to Boston, our home city, and would have been a great deal if we had known about it when making plans.) Okay, that's it. Good luck in making your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very convienient location”
Reviews.Author: Almaniac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, modern and up-to-date. the room we had seemed to have been recently updated, or the hotel is practically new. There is a subway stop directly below the hotel for both the main lines in Toronto making getting around town a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “A Okay”
Reviews.Author: Aeolis
Reviews.Content: Just what we were looking for after a trip from Europe. Visited my uncle nearby. Everything just right. No surprises. Good food too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Unsafe to stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jreekie23
Reviews.Content: While staying in this hotel someone broke into our room wile my boyfriend and I were sleeping and stole all of our money and credit cards. I am assuming it had to have been an inside job and that they were a professional pickpocket because we did not hear them. The hotel did nothing to help us except for a complimentary breakfast. The hotel proved to be completely unconcerned that this could happen to one of their customers while staying in one of their hotels. I will never stay in a Marriott hotel again. I strongly advise to look elsewhere for a hotel when staying in Toronto. I can not go back in time and change what happened to me but hopefully I can help make sure that this does not happen to someone else

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frontenis77
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, 100% luxury and with ease access by car, subway, taxi, etc

Reviews.Title: “A Room With a View”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: Yet another Priceline shopper! Location and price were wonderful - we took the train into the city & it was so fast and inexpensive going from Union Station to the hotel in minutes for under $5!...It is a lovely, but quirky hotel. There is only one set of elevators for each mazelike floor,lovely big windows that open up to an expanse of lower roof tops or the antics of other guests caught unaware. Plusses: Location! Cold weather not a problem with the metro under the hotel. Spacious room, nicely decorated with two full club chairs, ottoman, heavenly bed and linens. Bathroom is well thought out with nice lighting, mirrors andabundant shelving - nicely scented & presented Body Shop products. Service was top knotch. Nays: The views ( non exisitent). Lack of pool or spa - would've been so welcomed after a hard foot touring day! Internet connection charges!! Am a Marriott member and didn't know the fees could've been waived. Marriott is so below the curve on charging exhorbitant fees. Hints: Longos grocers next door - thank you previous reviewer! Made up a thrifty, healthy breakfast with Starbucks coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit and whole grain muffins for a faction of room service cost!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: travelchic70
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this downtown Toronto hotel and loved my experience! The staff were friendly and helpful and the guest room was very comfortable. I have to say I am a big Marriott fan, the beds are so comfortable that I am considering buying one for my home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mack09
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly, and consistently so. They were always around to help. The rooms were a good size, and the bed was so comfortable. I slept really well. The bathroom was also fantastic! There were great shelves, so it gave me lots of room to spread out my toiletries and makeup. I was hoping for a good view, but I had an inner courtyard room on a low floor. Probably because I got a corporate reduced rate. The room was still nice, but if you are going here on vacation, it would be a bummer. Make sure you get a higher floor room. It was very conveniently located- it is connected to an underground passage with access to the subway and stores. I was able to go get Starbucks without even going outside, which was wonderful in February! PS- sorry ab the photo quality- took them with my crappy camera phone.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ruzik
Reviews.Content: we went clubbing. Didn't want to drive home, so we decided to stay at Marriott. Booked through priceline. We payed $15 for parking. The room was very clean and nice. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dont drive your vehicle”
Reviews.Author: bikerpair2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the room which we had upgraded to was nice but dont expect a view. The hotel only has 6 floors and a lot of the rooms face an inner courtyard. The parking is terrible as work was being done on the lower levels which the communication between the hotel and the parking authority was lack there of... Everyone booking in had either parked in valet parking or ended up having to move their cars, then walk outside around the block. the signage for parking actually stinks and the bell boys don't have a clue when asking directions to the alternative parking arrangements. We were upgraded to the nicer room only cause we had to complain for at least 10 minutes regarding the ring around the rosie ie the parking. If you dont drive... this would be good for you... but if you do, then be prepared. Dont take kids here as no pool, no view and nothing for them to do. This hotel is great for a business suited person coming in from taxi or if you can well afford to pay for valet parking but be warned even there was an issue with 2 separate occasions while we were in the lobby of people having problems with the valet parking. The attendents were new, no manager on duty on the busiest night (new years eve and yet the charge was over $200.00. The hotel like I said is nice in decor... but I have seen better. If the staff were well versed on how to problem solve and if the manager was not out galavanting around when his/her staff were trying to problem solve, then I would recomend this hotel. They dont deserve the business.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: EarlRosebery
Reviews.Content: Very handy to shopping, subway, Royal Ont. Museum Clean helpful staff. Self parking $25 ?day. Charge for wi-fi can be acoided by signing up fpr Marriott club. Points can be transferred to airline program. Large clean room. Large clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Grenouillesansleau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in December: just before and just after a trip to see family at Christmas. I chose the Bloor St location because I was able to use my Cat 1-4 free night stay certificates here and because the location was very convenient for some last minute Christmas shopping (Yorkville was a little less frantic than the Eaton Centre) and dinner out with friends in Rosedale. For our paid stay after Christmas, we chose the Bloor St location because it was a little less expensive than the Eaton Centre location was beside the Avis location where we'd picked up our rental car. Our first room was on the Concierge level and for our second stay we were on the 4th floor. There is nothing special about the Concierge level rooms - and the lounge was closed during the week before Christmas. While the rooms were large and well-equipped (love the comfy Marriott bed), the rooms and hallways feel cramped (low ceilings). Our second room was not as clean as the first. While there is nothing to complain about regarding the decor in the rooms or reception area, there is nothing remarkable about them either. This is a standard, smallish Marriott that is in good shape although not up to the minute in terms of its decor. There is a fairly well-equipped gym although it also feels a bit cramped because there are no windows. Because the lounge was closed, we were given coupons for breakfast in the lobby restaurant. Breakfast was a fairly good spread (although the eggs were almost cold on our second visit). We had an exceptionally helpful waiter on our first morning, who went out of his way to make sure we could get a complete selection of breakfast items even though the buffet was supposed to have to shut down - we'd been told by reception it closed at 11 when in fact it closed at 10:30 (which was when we arrived). Staff on the desk were also friendly and helpful. Would I stay here again? It would depend on price compared to the Eaton Centre location and whether I was in town for work or play. For a leisure stay, I'd probably choose the Bloor St location only if it was priced more than $15 below the Eaton Centre location. If I'm working, I'd probably choose the Eaton Centre Marriott or downtown Residence Inn. I'd definitely choose the Bloor St Marriott over the Courtyard (and the Bloor Marriott often is the same or not much more expensive than the Courtyard) or the Renaissance Downtown (which often is more expensive than either the Bloor Marriott or Courtyard - and not worth it, in my opinion).

Reviews.Title: “Alright Hotel, Noisy Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: upsidedown_i
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location and decor of the Marriott Yorkville. However, our room's windows were facing the courtyard where, as the receptionist told me when I called to complain about the noise, "people go to smoke." There was a big group of people having a great, loud time until around 3:30 in the morning. I had asked the receptionist if it closes at a certain time so that we could get some sleep, and she said that it was the night manager's choice when to close it. She was vague and kind of rude in that she did not seem to care that the noise from these guests was bothering us. We booked this room through a third-party site. If we were to stay there again we would be sure to be far away from the courtyard. Also, they charged us for local calls! And wireless internet is not free on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: DLCAlberta
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Marriott from a long overseas flight and was nicely greeted at the front door and lobby. Best thing of all, they allowed me to choose some freebies and then sent them up to my room - a snack of wine, fruit, and pretzels in my case! My room was typical Marriott, roomy, comfortable and nicely furnished. The flatscreen TV was huge! Globe and Mail in the morning, quiet night, comfy bed, lots of pillows...and a breakfast buffet that was excellent and cheaper than some. I would happily go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Marriott @ Bloor & Younge is absolutely amazing all around!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Lesley
Reviews.Content: We won a weekend away in Toronto through the local radio station and the accommodations that were included were at the Marriott Bloor Yorkville. This also included valet parking and buffet breakfast each morning. Our experience far exceeded anything we expected right from booking the accommodations with Carlo to the turn down staff at night. Not once in 3 days did we see anyone, staff or guests, with an unpleasant look on their face. We were greeted every time we passed reception with a the appropriate comment (have a good day, good night, welcome back) and a giant smile. When we asked for recommendations for places to eat they were always eager to help and were bang on with their suggestions. We took the train to Toronto and were able to hop on the subway and get off steps from the hotel. Everything that we wanted to do was either a 5-10 minute walk or a quick subway ride. So, we didn't use valet parking but did have experience with their staff as well. We stored our luggage before check in and after check out. This service was convenient and trust worthy. The buffet breakfast was a great start to our day. It was actually a full breakfast with eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, fruit, cereal, juice...the works. Again the wait staff were super friendly and the food was very tasty. We checked and the cost was about $15 which isn't unreasonable for a weekend breakfast included the best orange juice ever at a hotel. By the way I asked what kind it was because I wanted to buy some and the server told us it was a special Marriott blend that couldn't be bought --- darn! The room we got was extra special because of our prize and was located on the concierge level and had a king suite that was a place I could live in permanently. There were 42" TV's in both rooms, a walk in closet and of course a very comfortable king size bed. If you are looking to be pampered for a weekend without a budget definitely pick the concierge level. You have special privileges in a private room that is like a hospitality suite including a couple of computers if you need one. There is turn down service each night that includes chocolates and they serve a cheese platter on the night of your arrival. I did 'peak' into a regular room and it had the same decor and was very clean. We quite often travel to Toronto but have never thought to stay downtown, all that has changed now! Marriott Bloor is our hotel of choice the next time we go to Toronto. So in short I would recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Solid performer”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: This centrally located business class hotel lacks an impressive lobby or public areas, but for it's a solid Marriott experience. Large well maintained and renovated rooms tastefully decorated. Workable desk area and chair. Plenty of illumination throughout.. Quiet rooms and comfortable bedding complete the experience. In room wired & wireless Internet with good access speeds. Service is friendly and efficient. This is not a dazzling property but a quality property for an executive in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean and quiet rooms "”
Reviews.Author: GregKara
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and I stayed down here on the Friday of thanksgiving weekend after getting a great price on line last minute . We checked in at 7 pm very quickly and very politley by the check in desk. went into our room and showered. The bathroom was a bit small but very nicley decorated and very clean. left for the night and came back after midnight to go to bed. The bed was a king and was soft and comfortable and there was no noise to be heard in the halls or other rooms. woke up at 10 am and checked out at 10:45. The hotel has no ppol which was a disappointment but had a very well equipped gym. This is an excellent hotel if you are looking for a very nice room, comfy bed, and just a place to leave your suitcase if you can get it for a good price but not recommended for families trying to keep kids entertained . great location though for shopping and sight seeing as its connected right to the TTC Subway

Reviews.Title: “A Bloor street bore in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated on Bloor St. by Yonge St. in downtown Toronto. Itâ€™s on the northern edge of downtown and surrounded by restaurants and business offices. This older hotel has only 6 floors and is surrounded by business offices, so nice views are hard to come by. Next door is the Hudson Bay Company and TTC Subway station, great to get anywhere you need ($2.50/ride). Across the street at the corner of Bloor & Church is the Grace Hospital Health Centre, with a large paid parking lot ($10/Day on weekend & $30/day weekday).
