Proceeds from parking at the health centre go back to the hospital and is comparable to the hotel's $30/day. The lobby is small and serviced by a single restaurant/bar. There appears to be three elevators but only two were operational during my 3-night stay. Internet cost $17/day and I worked out at their gym daily â€“ nothing too impressive but it did the job. There was no pool but saunas are connected to the change rooms. My room was rather large (approx. 650sf) with a single king size bed. Granite counter tops and modern furniture are standard throughout the hotel. The flat panel television is larger than usual and provides a good amount of channels. The carpet looks new but the wallpaper is not. Nothing stood out in terms of style and rooms lacked a polished touch. During busy periods, you can hear your neighbours next door when they speak as the walls are thin. Pets are also allowed and I heard barking throughout the night. Staff members at the hotel are friendly and did their best but never seemed that busy. The hotel doesnâ€™t seem to get as much business as some of the other hotels downtown. Room safes are provided for your valuables but there is no mini fridge. The temperature control never worked during my stay but held at a comfortable 73F temperature; fine by me. Overall, the hotel is well located away from the busy downtown core (20 minute walk to Eaton Centre) and provides service to the northern edge of businesses downtown. Itâ€™s a business hotel with multiple board rooms and halls. However, itâ€™s clear that the Marriott Bloor Yorkville requires updating to keep a 4-star status. The lack of a swimming pool, bland hallways, city view, and thin walls was unacceptable for a hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: russdorth
Reviews.Content: The Marriot on Bloor is not the best looking hotel, in fact its down right ugly. The purpose at staying at this location was to take our daughter to University. The rooms were small but nice and the location was great. We looked out our window to a courtyard of over grown plants and garbage. The lobby was small and not a place to hang out. In all the room served its purpose and the location was great at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: Loved the bathroom, room and pillows! The staff was really friendly again, specially the guy opening the doors (the door man) EVERY time he saw us, it almost made me a little uncomfortable because he went out of his way to make sure he had that door open even before we got there. The room was decorated very stylish and the bathrooms were; wow! twin sinks and rain shower, plus a tub. I think the secret is to be treated as a celebrity even when you are not one! One tiny complain was the weird noise coming from the ceiling? or maybe the adjacent wall, we couldn't figure it out, where it was coming from but it was a little noisy.... and the view wasn't that great either but it doesn't matter if you go to Toronto to shop and eat out.... I would love to come back here. Nicely priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: p8patyger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on top of the Bloor and Yonge station. It is convenient to travel by subway in just about every direction. It is not as noisy and crowded as other neighbourhoods in downtown Toronto. We have four people staying in a room with two queen beds and it doesn't feel cramped. The hotel was renovated a couple of years ago and feels quite fresh. HD TV is a pleasure to watch. The lobby is quite small and undistinctive. The front desk is not staffed as fully as it should. One Saturday afternoon, the concierge wasn't there. We waited about 10 minutes to get a bandaid. The restaurant looks dark and unappealing. Overall, nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very average... for a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eldiablo2010
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not a 4-star hotel. 3 or 3 1/2 at the most. It may not matter in the end to some, but if i shop a star rating & pay for it in accordance, i want it to be real. This one is a bit overrated. From the get-go, we stumbled upon a very lost check-in female clerk that didn't book the right number of beds for us. After taking multiple, clueless looks at our reservation voucher, she got the rudest manager, an petite Asian woman named Elizabeth, to second her in what turned out to be a disastrous (first-time) Marriott customer service experience for us & a show of insufferable intolerance by a Marriott's managing staff member. I would be tempted to call Elizabeth a 'b*tch' but my Mama raised me better than that... so I won't & have pity for her sad, angry heart. Of course, having booked our room with a third-party hotel room provider, Elizabeth was quick to conveniently say that they had nothing to do with the error & that we would have to seek for the third-party to solve it. That would be true IF i didn't check & got my official confirmation number with Marriott's direct reservation service (located in Miami) who confirmed, twice to my request, that 2 beds were indeed booked (3 weeks in advance) with other simple, less important, demands that were also grossly & uninterestedly overlooked. Basically, the hotel screwed this up for us & in a stride of really bad luck for Elizabeth, the customer behind me had THE SAME PROBLEM & was quick to enter the conversation, supporting us, understandably worrying about his own troubles ahead, with the possible & most likely identical outcome. We did NOT stay for that showdown. Then, in a manner that I could only relate to psychological & uncontrollable distress, Elizabeth tried to shut us, raising her voice saying, & I precisely quote: "I am so sick of dealing with you both that I will bump down somebody else's room to a single bed & give it to you". She added, mockingly: " They will just have to deal with THAT when they check in" (relating to the other, now bumped-down, customers). This is unspeakably displaced anger that no paying customers want to hear & a service 'faux-pas' worthy of unemployment! Even though I was happy to receive what I generously paid & asked for in advance, I was stunned & sadden for the other people that were now tricked with our problem & the person behind us who was also stuck in a ONE king-size bedroom with a party-of-4. We just moved on, deciding to try & enjoy our weekend in Toronto & let the mean woman suffer her job out. We had no energy for that. The room was very average with a view on old buildings. I would say that it was no better than a 3-star room. It was fairly clean & rather new, if not 3-star, not much more. The beds were comfortable, clean & soft. The room service was rather quick & friendly. The rest of the stay went smoothly & we did not see Elizabeth again, grinding her teeth at other poor unsuspecting tourists. Surprisingly, there is no pool in the hotel. I've been to 2-stars hotels in Mexico that had rooftop pools. This one doesn't have any. I've spent my weekend wondering where they got their star-ratings from & I am still clueless to how. I stay frequently in hotels (3, 4, & 5-stars) & I just can't figure it out. The hotel is quite well located & in a safe area. Access to the subway is footsteps away & it is to walkable distance to downtown. There are tons of very average & steep-looking Asian & Indian restaurants around & it is located in an older residential part north of downtown (Yorkville) that is slowly being transformed into a trendy neighborhood, yet that is for now quite ugly & need tons of work to be done. If you are looking to be stunned by the beauty & trendiness of your surroundings, please go elsewhere. Though I enjoyed my stay in Toronto, I would NOT book with this hotel again, & since this is my first stay at a Marriott, I would probably pick another hotel chain too. I wish Elizabeth well & for her to find a job that will NOT inquire her to be at the service nor collaborate with other human beings.

Reviews.Title: “Three and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has both good and bad points, and was definitely ok for a business trip where I only spent the night in my room. Good points: Central location over Toronto's two main subway lines at the intersection of Bloor & Yonge No connecting doors to adjoining room, and no internal noise from other hotel guests or elevators, etc. Good quality and promptly delivered room service breakfast. Spacious and well furnished room. Bad points: Being directly above Toronto's busiest subway station led to continuous rumbling noise from trains, between 5 am until after midnight. I got used to it, but the ultra-sensitive would need earplugs. Filthy air vent in bathroom - had not been cleaned in months judging from the dust that I had to wipe off. Slow drain in sink and toilet that didn't stop flushing without regular jiggling of flush handle. A majority of rooms (including mine) have no view - looking over an inner courtyard. Although there is a direct internal connection between the subway station and the hotel it is poorly marked from the subway arrival end, and it is hard to access the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Has washer and dryer; Visit the Science Museum”
Reviews.Author: stangina
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the G20 meeting, so hotel had challenges but handled all well. Had two rooms, one on points. Worked out very well; staff very helpful from the bell staff handling the parking and unpacking to the front desk and restaurant. Warning - no extra beds allowed in rooms. Hotel is at intersection of the two main underground lines, so very convenient but still a bit of a distance from downtown. Eaton Marriott is better located. Super high end market next door, with tables so took some meals there. Internet slow and intermittent. Has a washer and dryer next to the fitness center - very convenient. Marriott Concierge lounge was good and staff very helpful. Went to the Science museum by taxi (expensive - returned by bus and train much better) - a must visit if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 5ks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott for five nights. Had a great time. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the location could not have been better. Only minutes away from shopping, restaurants, and the subway is right below the hotel. There is a great market next door when the kids needed a evening snack. The only drawback is that there is no free internet, but otherwise we would highly recommend this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slightly outdated”
Reviews.Author: MiamiKeyWest
Reviews.Content: Superb location, very central, close to Yorkville, friendly staff, great fitness room. Outdated interior, lack of light on lower floors, no free wireless, no terminal to check e-mails.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: weglow4
Reviews.Content: Room was okay. Seemed a bit aged. The location could not be beat. Subway, TTC, right under hotel. Requested extra towels (there were four people in room) and they never came, but the night manager was very helpful and kind. Lobby nothing special. No free internet in room. Probably would have rated hotel a bit lower if I paid for it, but we used points, so it was worth the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly and Unexpectedly Welcomed”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLover129
Reviews.Content: I was thinking this was going to be like any other 4 star Mariott in an Urban centre, but I was so wrong. It is in a great location and if you are looking to drop a couple grand on bloor west, you are two minute walk away from making your bank account weep. All the staff were very courteous and helpful. The rooms were your typical 270 sqft, "contemorary beds" with a chair and a plasma tv. The restaurant was a little cheesy, but had pretty good food and was very convenient. All in all, this hotel is very nice. WIll it compare to the "regency, luxury, and elegance," the hyatt, four seasons, or Hazelton Hotel will offer, but its a great alternative for the same location, while putting $150+ in your pocket per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get a deal. Nice location for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: NEEDAVACAPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal via hotwire.com. We traveled with another couple for a weekend getaway and didn't particularly care about the hotel, as long as it was 4 star. We were pleasantly surprised by the Marriott Bloor. Parking - this was a challenge. One of the lots was closed, but the lot under the hotel was relatively inexpensive for city parking for the weekend. Once we parked, we left the car and used the subway. If you have seen the construction on Bloor, you will not want to do much driving, either! Service - I was a little frustrated upon check in. They could not accommodate a request for two beds and, frankly, I was a little anxious from the long drive. The ladies at the desk took great care of us. One offered complimentary breakfast at Matisse simple because "they want to see happy people at their hotel." By the way - the breakfast and service was great. Cute little place. The gym facilities were beyond my expectations. Several of each machine and multiple tvs. Overall, the rooms were clean, beds comfortable, and location was convenient to the subway, restaurants, and high end shopping. We were pleased with our experience, especially with the value we got using hotwire.com.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else: rooms cold, front desk atrocious, internet poor”
Reviews.Author: mentaltraveller
Reviews.Content: The front desk was continually incompetent, through the full five days, from check in to check out. They confused the reservation, they confused the kind of room, they had never seen Marriott rewards members before, it seemed. It took me more time to check in and be finished with them and finally have my room to settle into, than it did to fly there. The attitude was always: prepare for disappointment. Many of them used the same phrase: "I'll tell you what I can and cannot do": to the most standard request: such as: here is my guaranteed reservation. I have stayed hundreds of nights at Marriotts and this was the worst front desk service I have ever encountered. Actually, I had to stand in line behind other customers who were having similar problems with the front desk. The staff could be heard discussing the customers, it seems they did not like the customers' attitudes. Even when some managers tried to address problems, the solutions were lost by the next shift and everything had to start from zero; or again there would be someone new who couldn't work the solution and would start back off again with: "Let me tell you what I can and cannot do". The TV did not work and it took several hours to fix. The concierge level offered minimal breakfast selections, and did not have "snacks all day". Very limited offerings. The elevators were extremely slow, many people waiting for them, and after five minutes waiting for the elevator, people would start to chat, all with the same concerns: the extremely cold rooms, the very poor and intermittent internet service. The only plus side: the room cleaning service and room service personnel were friendly, efficient, very good at their jobs. All the problems relate to management and the front desk. Location was superb, but so is the location of many downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable internet at the business hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Pragmatic2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't have much to offer in terms of design features or "experience". One thing they can do is to get fast internet so people can get their work done. When that doesn't work, there is little point of staying there. If you don't need fast internet, the place is OK... rooms are large, TV is there, gym is bigger than one would expect...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay , Convenient to University of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jptreacy
Reviews.Content: we actually stayed here on a comp through marriott rewards. Staff was excellent! We stayed in room 631 view of courtyard, well appointed room . 42" TV , nicely decorated room, refrigerator, nice bathroom too. I believe it was recently renovated. Garage was $26.55/day with in & out privaleges... WELL WORTH IT! We stayed over on thursday nite checked in at noon and left at 9am. Staff was very friendly, turn down service at nite was nice. This place is alot nicer than the Courtyard Marriott on Yonge St. (Stayed theire 3 times) The only thing missing was a swimming pool. There is a nice concierge lounge on 6th floor that provides breakfast in morning and snacks all day long! If the price is right I'd go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelCriticKy
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this Marriott. Everything was fresh and seemed new. The beds and pillows were comfortable and I was able to sleep through the night. Close to the Church St restaurants and activity.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: I found here is nothing particularly redeeming about this hotel, which several reviewers seem to love. The location isn't great for business downtown and basically they took a shabby old hotel did some renovation work to make it acceptable but I think the end result was quite ordinary. Generally speaking the Marriotts are a cut below the other chains in Toronto (Sheraton, Hyatt, Delta, etc) and I can't think of a good reason other than price to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Bad construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Jase-TO
Reviews.Content: My wife an I decided to take our first weekend break since having our daughter last July. The plan was to chill out in a nice hotel while Grandma took care of our little girl at home. The hotel is really nice, staff are friendly and the location is great. Until this morning (Saturday) I had no complaint, but our relaxing sleep in and chill out in the room until lunch isn't happening because of the loud jack hammering that sounds like it's coming from the room beside us. According to the front desk it's not in the hotel. I understand that, but why isn't there something on the website warning of the noise? There aren't many chances for my wife and I to take a break like this and I'm a little peeved that The Marriott wasn't more forthcoming with information about construction noise BEFORE I BOOKED! Other than that the hotel is fine. Ordinary as far as hotels go but nothing really to complain about, besides the noise.

Reviews.Title: “The Bed felt like I was sleeping on a cloud!”
Reviews.Author: faycandice
Reviews.Content: Really well kept hotel. Clean, spacious, beautiful rooms. The bed felt we were sleeping in a soft cloud... loved it. Nice bathroom. Check out time was at 1 pm - which was great. Right across the street was a great little restaurant called Peridot - nice ambience there. Not a noisy hotel - wasnt disturbed by anyone in the next room or in the hallway. Very pleased with the choice and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel, But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: misplacedmaritimer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Toronto Marriott at Bloor. There's nothing wrong with this hotel (it's perfectly fine), but there's nothing particularly special about it either. We booked through Hotwire and got a great deal, so we have nothing to complain about. However, we noted the hotel is a little worse for wear in spots (the room doors look old, and the paint was badly chipped on the closet door in our room). There's no pool or spa -- I sort of expect a pool for a four star hotel. It's nicely decorated, and the staff were helpful (even moving us to the top floor on check-in). The walls might be a little thin (our neighbours woke us up in the early morning). I'd probably give it a 3.5 star rating overall. The location is good if you want to be conveniently located to Yorkville. I wouldn't discourage someone from staying here, but I also think there a lot more interesting and/or nicer places to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spacious Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RaeJay
Reviews.Content: I was able to use my travel agent discount for this, so I don't know exactly what the value for room would be. I must say though, the room we did receive was beautiful! When we walked in the first thing I saw was the flat screen tv, and I said "wow, we can watch that tv from our bed. My husband then replied "Theres no need, there is another tv right here". It seems like something silly to notice, but yes, there were 2 huge flat screen tvs right in the room. There is also a door to separate the bedroom from the living room area, so if you choose to use it, you can. The bathroom has nice amenities, and clean towels and the hotel staff was friendly upon check in. We stayed for 2 nights, the location is close to the subway, so you can travel that way or take a cab. We parked a few blocks away in a Green P and the price wasn't bad for that either. We had a great stay at the hotel, and I would definately stay there again if I am in that area of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “good location, staff friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hec286
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for meetings (on site). Nothing bad to say about the hotel. It was clean, my room and all the others I saw were large, with good size bathrooms. Staff were attentive and friendly. Location is in the downtown, close to shopping and several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “contruction hammering below all day”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms start at 6th floor. Expensive weekday hotel parking down in Basement levels which is actually above ground garage levels on top of street level Bays shopping mall. Weekend hotel parking is CN$25 per day, weekday at 40. Downstairs ground level Bays Shopping mall have 2 food courts, but was closed every time we were looking for dinner. Quite expensive restaurants at within this block west areas along Yonge Street. More reasonably price restaurants are on the east side along Mount Pleasant Road areas. Subway station entrances are beneath the shopping mall. Downstairs garage levels on top of the Bay shopping mall is under construction. Loud jack hammer going all day till 5pm including Saturday. No warning on web site. Only told customers at check in, kept saying it is not their fault. Avoid turning right existing garage, Bloor street is dug up for extensive construction. Massive grid lock. Got 5 rooms at good prices at Priceline.com for weekend. Avoid rooms near elevators (room with low numbers) because of elevator cable knocking noises. Excellent room furnishing. Large LCD flat screen TV, but only typical few hotel channels, and shown in lowest composite NTSC resolution, what a shame. No mini-refrigerators or mini-bar or microwave. Hate shower without flow volume control â€“ only one setting in full blast and waste of water â€“ stupidest American invention. Mini-safe and coffer maker. Stiff sheets. One type of blanket in dawn feather. Tough for Californians unable to overnight adjust to this. Can only sleep next night by cooling the room down below 60. Competent staff at registration. Room internet charge $13.60 per day. But free wifi at lobby, what a hassle, I guess encourage hotel elite rating. Breakfast buffet at $17.50. Good fitness. Business center allow free printing of airline boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!x1000000000000000000000”
Reviews.Author: browniesyay
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great the staff is very good the rooms are 5 stars alone for a toronto hotel the walls are sound proofed well i would think at first that it was in downtown rome i love the subway station below is there anything else to say oh! this trip was very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very VERY FABULOUSLY SPECTACULARLY DARN AWESOME MORE THAN THAT I AM JUST SPEECHLESS NOW I AM DONE AND I THINK I SHOULD BE SPEECHLESS FORVER L8R!

Reviews.Title: “not the best, but not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: danielagoncalves
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends celebrating a birthdayin the city and booked two rooms for 8 people. both rooms were nice and looked like they had been updated recently. One of the rooms had a heating issue and a hotel employee came up to look at the heater at 330am, he was very helpful. They ended up switching the room for another room across the hall where the heat wasn't blasting. The only issue i had was trying to locate the other guests in the morning, the front desk person would not tell me where they had been moved, even though it was my name on the reservation. We asked the front desk staff to recomend a breakfast place to us, which they did, but the information was outdated and the restaurant had been closed for some time. Other than that the staff were friendly and helpful. it was nice to know they were willing to help at such an early hour. I read some poor reviews, and they must have been from before some kind of reservation work was done because the lobby and the hallways, along with the rooms were clean and very nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good price it's a great place to stay despiste some negative points”
Reviews.Author: mute_suds
Reviews.Content: POSITIVE: Great spacious clean rooms. The bed was really comfortable. Huge LCD tv â€“ with a connection board for laptops and other devices. Great location â€“ at the top of the Yorkville downtown area. Friendly staff. NEGATIVE Internet is not free â€“ over CAD 13 per day. No breakfast included â€“ over CAD 13. Paid parking (if you donâ€™t move the car the whole weekend itâ€™s just 15 CAD).

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: LikeLux4value
Reviews.Content: Try to get a room that does not look in on the courtyard. We had a north facing room that had a nice enough view but the rooms that look out on the courtyard have a dreary view. We had a room with a king-size bed. The non-suite rooms are on the small side but are very well laid out with nice updated furniture and cheerful decor. I liked the Toronto themed colour photos that were on the walls as artwork. The bed was super comfortable. There is no mini bar but there were robes. The safe is a drawer type. The flat panel TV is huge but does not seem to get HD channels. I was easily able to attach my portable audio/video player. We had breakfast in their pleasant restaurant. The lobby is average but functional. Don't expect anything extravagant. Some people have complained about how far a walk it is to the rooms. This is because of the courtyard setup. I didnâ€™t think it was a big deal. The bathroom was small but nice. On the weekend it is cheaper to pay the parking directly at $5 a day than pay the hotel rate. Only minor complaint was on check out we were pleasantly told by the desk person we have to wait a few minutes for the manager to return and give us the gift card which we were to receive with our package. When the manager came she didn't say a word, just handed us the card and walked away. No apology for the 5 minute wait. She also did not tell us how to activate the card since you need to know the code. I found it rather odd. On the other hand we had blown a fuse in our room while using the hair dryer and trying to turn up the heat at the same time. I called the front desk and someone was up within 3 minutes to reset the circuit breaker found in a hall closet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room in central location”
Reviews.Author: Visenta
Reviews.Content: Hotel of quality. Spacious room. TV films still running on Video Tape. Certainly not worth ordering. Reception notes that this is run by an contracted company. As a film buff, a complete waste of time and money. Specially as the TV in the room is of high quality. Lifts are agonisingly slow. Room service excellent. Hotel close to a main underground transport intersection and undergrpound shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, outdated decor, limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: MyleenAustin
Reviews.Content: I would give this more like a 3.5 stars only because the location is unbeatable. It is right above the subway station, undersground mall/food court and is considered "the center" of Toronto. If you like fine dining or expensive shopping, you can walk 5 minutes and you're there. There are also a good variety of cheap/ethnic eateries up and down Yonge St. As busy as this area is, we didn't hear any traffic noise and slept well on very comfortable beds. No problems also with cleanliness. Now for the not so good part - for a "4 star" hotel, you would expect nicer furnishings. Both the lobby and the rooms looked like they haven't been refurbished since the late 80s. The room we were in was not proportionate, as the suite was super large, but the bathroom was tiny in comparison. Costs for Internet ($14/day) and valet parking ($35/day) were pretty outrageous. Considering you spend over $200/night for this place, you would hope they can provide free Internet. Even lower level hotels give it away for free! Anyways, the room just didn't seem "worth it". If you don't care about looks, then I guess it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and enormous room!!”
Reviews.Author: Veganon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Hotel on Bloor for two nights on the 12/13th October. My first impressions were very positive - the staff were helpful, they had complied with our request for a room on a higher floor and the room when we arrived was enormous - as was the bed! It was our fist night in Toronto and we were feeling tired. We were able to walk in all directions from the hotel and find restaurants and bars, and the subway and shopping centres are literally on your doorstep. The first night was very quiet and we got a good sleep, the second night we could hear a guy in the room next door talking on his cell phone, but wehn we got back later there was again no noise and we slept well. The room and bathroom were well decorated and well appointed and extremely clean. And when we went to pick up our hire care form Avis we found out we could even access that by the elevator in the hotel - perfect! We ate out for breakfast every day at Le Pain Quotidean on Yonge just around the corner - excellent breakfast!! So no comments on quality of the hotel restaurant. As vegetarians though we found Toronto was wonderful for food!! This hotel was good value for a city hotel and ideally situated - a good introduction to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: andreachiquita7
Reviews.Content: the best, every single thing...im coming back pretty soon, for a week...i love the suit.....amazin....dont pay attention about the elevators, it doesnt matter...the hotel is gorgeous, pretty, i loved the city, expensive but it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Great Deal, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bp_thegolfpro
Reviews.Content: I'm normally pretty picky when it comes to hotels and accomodations. After we were able to pick up the hotel off Priceline for $118, we weren't expecting what we got... First off, we showed up early, and I figured there was no way of an early check-in (noon), but to my surprise, the very friendly woman at the desk found us a room within minutes and we were checked in very quckly. The room is very large for the price we paid. The room has been beautifully renovated recently, with a very stylish bathroom. 40" Plasma screen, and wireless internet. The location of the hotel is as good as it gets for Yorkville. We will definitely be returning to the hotel any time we need to be in that area! Make sure you do some looking through the different online sites and get yourself a good bargain. It is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Large Room”
Reviews.Author: PositiveThinking1
Reviews.Content: The only downside is that you have to go down to the lobby to get a free wireless connection. This surprises me because most hotels have free wireless or wired connection in their rooms. Maybe this could be their next upgrade. A young lady at the front desk was totally stressed out but she did her best to give us a good service.

Reviews.Title: “A marriot with a small m”
Reviews.Author: sexy69
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is the big selling point for this property. It is right above one of Toronto's busy subway stations and surrounded by shops, restaurants and attractions. Inside there is a pleasant enough lobby and adjacent to it the Matisse restaurant. Having said all this however I have to say that my stay wasn't as pleasant as I would have liked. When comparing it to stays at the Marriott Copenhagen and the Jw Marriot Grand Lakes orlando, it fell a bit short of expectations. I'm a Marriott rewards member and generally favour this chain above the others for its customer service across properties but at this stay it was not up to par. I am a blind guest who requires a tad more attention when staying at a hotel and while this Marriott did assist me; I felt like I was being tolerated rather then being viewed as a valued guest. My room although large was a room for a wheelchair user; I guess blind/ wheelchair its all a disability to the front desk and gave me this room. I in turned asked for a regular room but when I said I was staying only one night, the manager stated the hotel was full. Yeah right, maybe so but as a Marriott rewards member they could have tried a little harder. There was nothing really wrong with the room but I would have prefered a bathtub rather then a walk in shower. Other then that minor quibble the room was comfortable and rather large. It had two sitting areas, two queen size beds, the vaunted 42 inch flat screen TV I didn't actually measure it and even a fridge which I had requested prier to arriving. It also had the plate of chocolate truffles and fruit which I requested prier as well. I guess for one night it wasn't bad. There was also a coffee maker and safe which were easy to use even for someone who is completely blind. I had a great meal at the restaurant Matisse which was rather quite affordable. My waiter offered to read the menu although by his tone it sounded like he wasn't thrilled to do so. The restaurant wasn't full at all so I wasn't holding him up in any way. It was the little things like these that really got to me. When i requested an escort upon chekc out, I was told I had to wait and to call back in ten minutes. Screw that and headed out myself. I wanted to try the fitness centre but time did not permit that in the end. I was told it was good with a sauna and changing facilities. Check out was a tad frustrating as the woman couldnt' get her printer to work. I merely wanted the bill read out to me and have each charge itemized. I did get this in the end. I guess to sum it up, while there was customer service it felt it was carried out by automatons rather then flesh and blood employees who were happy to be working in this profession. I would recommend this hotel if nothing else for the location but don't expect much. Maybe the second time round will be a diffrent experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “awesome room not much else”
Reviews.Author: bro12345
Reviews.Content: pros: room was much more than expected and it had pretty much everything. cons: pricey rooms service screwed up breakfast location & parking a mess (construction may have contributed to the problem)

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Yorkville”
Reviews.Author: Duxburygirl
Reviews.Content: A little gem in Yorkville, a delightful Toronto neighborhood with lovely cafes, restaurants and shopping. Excellent service and warm, attentive staff. Large rooms. Surprisingly good restaurant. Wonderful location. Excellent (although pricey) internet connection in room. Overall, a great value. Only drawback: construction in the neighborhood and right in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Atl-RT
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Toronto and this hotel was very nice. I normally stay at Marriott properties when vacationing (just a personal preference), and this hotel was definitely up to par. It was very clean and stylish on the inside. It is located right above the subway, which can be a bit noisy at times but is great for getting around. It wasn't too bad though- I didn't lose any sleep:). The staff was superb!!! Very personable and informative. Thanks Wayne and Geoff! Overall this hotel has a great location, great staff, and nice clean rooms. I didn't try the restaurant, although it looked nice. There are so many great spots within walking distance and the subway is right there if you need to get anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Superb; great accessible room”
Reviews.Author: Nadreck
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently stayed at this hotel and were favorably impressed. I reserved a studio room (small suite) and specifically asked for it because my mother needed a walk in shower and this was almost the only hotel I could find in the area I wanted (near Bloor) that had an accessible room with two beds that was not a basic standard (read: small) room. The room was wonderful, large, clean and quiet (it faced Bloor street but despite construction little or no noise). For those who want a view: even this room didn't have much of a view - only a bit of Yonge street in the distance, and a large high rise across the street. Most of the rooms in the hotel face a central courtyard - again no view. But, we didn't come here for a view. We were more interested in comfort and location. The room had a small seating area with couch and chairs, and large walk in shower with higher toilet seat (accessible) and as well as two closets (one with a lower bar for those who are in wheelchair) and door had two peepholes - again a lower one for those in wheelchair. The spaciousness of the room was impressive. I also liked the toiletries (Bath and Body Works aromatherapy). Finally a lotion that was thicker than water and actually lubricated the skin. We had a very good price (almost half of what was quoted for a suite in a recent review) and it included complimentary breakfast (made via Marriott website). The staff were the most outstanding feature of this hotel - they were friendly, courteous, helpful and because the hotel is smaller than many others they remembered us day to day. One example: I asked someone at the front desk about printing my airline boarding passes, was directed to the concierge and later on the person at the front desk asked me if I had managed to get them printed - she wanted to make sure. Amazing! The valet service and the restaurant staff were the same way. Housekeeping was also great (room cleaned promptly, and saying hello and smiling in the hallway as we passed by). As others have noted, construction makes it a bit difficult getting around if you are using a car, but not impossible, and I was told construction would be done by this fall, so won't be an issue for much longer. The location is also a great feature as others have noted, with the Bloor-Yonge subway and the shopping underneath the hotel. The food in the restaurant was fine, although I think a different menu with some lighter and more vegetarian options would be my preference. I don't always have room for a large entree. Although I came here for leisure, I can see that this hotel would be fine for business. I made good use of the gym (well equipped). Athough I didn't use it, the room was equipped for using a computer. I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville excellent but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtrav
Reviews.Content: Recently returned fron a one week vacation in Toronto - chose the Marriott Bloor Yorkville due to the prime location in the center of the chic Yorkville section of town with its great shopping and swank and elegant vibe. I have been to Toronto many times before and this is my favorite part of town to be in. That said, I must mention that the hotel became a Marriott fairly recently and was under varoius owners before that (including a Radisson during which time I stayed previously). In its most recent reincarnation as a Marriott changes were made made to the hotel some good, some not as good. I will detail these now starting with the cons and getting this out of the way first. Cons: 1)The building housing the hotel is now a mixed-use hotel condo development with the condos occupying the upper floors and the Marriott hotel occupying the lower six floors (the sixth is the Concierge Level). What this means is that the views from the rooms in the rear (where my room was located) are decidedly urban (surrounded by other tall buildings rather than a sweeping panoramic view. When I asked about another view at reception, I was kindly told that the best rooms were in front of the hotel overlooking Bloor Street and that these were suites currently going for $450.00 Canadian! The remaining rooms were in back like mine or overlooking a charmless dark courtyard - the lady at reception said that I would not want one of those rooms; I appreciated her honesty on that point. So don't stay at this hotel expecting a panoramic view unless you choose a suite. That said, this issue was not a big enough deal to negatively impact my stay or prevent me from returning in the future. You are in a big city after all. . 2) Please note that if you plan on staying at this hotel in the near future that Bloor Street which fronts the hotel is under construction. If you are planning on spending a great deal of time in your room, I would suggest staying in the back of the hotel. The noise was audible but not awful, and then again this is an issue which would bother some people but probably not others. However think twice about staying in a courtyard facing room - if the staff steered me away from those rooms, that must say something, I think! On the bright side it looks as if the construction is winding down, so this may not be an issue for long. 3) Internet access is very expensive. If you connect in your room it costs $13.95 for 24 hrs. If you use the computers in the business center you must swipe your credit card and be charged a $5.00 minimum or 49 cents a minute. However, using your own computer in the lobby and restaurant is free! Why is it that most higher-end hotels keep charging for this service while midrange and lower-end hotels don't. Marriott, I enjoy staying at your hotels whenever I can, but this issue was a turn-off! On the bright side the business center computer does allow you to print airline boarding passes for free. 4) Breakfasts at the hotel are on the expensive side. $17.95 for the buffet and similarly high a la carte pricing, I would recommend the mall below the hotel in the morning (more on that below). I did have dinner at the hotel one night, which I very much enjoyed - sure, it was expensive, but the quality of the food and the service made this worth it. The restaurant by the way is called Matisse and is a beautiful, atmospheric room with paintings of the namesake artist all over the walls. Now for the pros and there were many: The rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished in a chic, modern style with elegant wood furniture and extremely comfortable beds with an abundance of pillows to choose from. I've always had a great sleep in Marriott beds and this hotel was no exception. The room also had an in-room safe (wish all hotels had these) and the biggest flat-screen TV i've seen in a hotel room. The chairs were super comfortable and the bathroom was the nicest I've seen in a long time - not huge, but generously laid out with knick-nack shelves on each side of the sink, high-end toiletries and a huge decadent showerhead that was a dream to use! The lobby is rather small but intimate at the same time - once the construction is over it will gain much-needed space. For now, guests must walk into the lobby through the valet park- ing entrance on the side - not a big deal but it takes a little getting used to. I must also mention the service at the hotel which was exemplary and courteous at all times and very helpful with any inquiries I had regarding either my stay or with sightseeing options in Toronto. Lastly, the Marriott's location is unbeatable. It is in Yorkville, one of Toronto's best neighbor- hoods and the building is located directly above the city's biggest subway stop and a network of underground shopping malls so that you have all-weather access to transportation and shopping without even going outdoors if you wish. To easily access the mall from the lobby, walk toward the elevators and make a left before you get to them - you will see a glass door which will lead you to either the stairs or elevator to the mall. Once down there the subway is to the right and a food court to the left where there are several places grab a quick and cheap breakfast, lunch or snack. Past the subway (to the right of the door leading to the mall there is also a Starbucks serving coffee, breakfast and pastries. Also in the same vicinity is Shoppers Drug Mart store open 24 hours. Apart from this you have acess to a variety of other shops and services right under the hotel and then you hop on the subway to anywhere in the city you want to go - can't be beat. So, despite some of my personal observations stated above, I would heartily recommend the Marriott Toronto Bloor-Yorkville as a handy and very comfortable base to explore Toronto, one of the most fascinating and freindliest cities in North America. I hope that your stay at this property will be a memorable one. I will certainly keep the hotel in mind for future visits to Toronto. I am sure it can only get better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Texan24
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to spend a few days for Gay Pride. Location was excellent. Just a few blocks from the Gay Village, Younge Street and Great shopping. Took a cab from Pearson Airport. $52.00 flat rate not including tip. Did research on TripAdvisor and it was a good choice. Last year stayed at Marriott Eaton Center which was also great but further from the activities. They were in the process of doing some construction on Bloor street which was very loud during the day but no fault of Marriott. Check-in was very quick and staff were very courteous. Elevators throughout the stay were very slow for some reason. Room was very clean and updated and carpet was very clean. Stayed in room 332. If you want a quick trip to some shopping there is a mall bellow the hotel with a food court, Starbucks, Liquor store, Drugstore and a lot of others. Free Wi-Fi in lobby with password from front desk. Carpet in room was clean. Room itself was very clean and bathroom also was clean. Room was quiet and could not hear people in rooms next door but could hear people speaking in the hallway. AC worked well. Room service was quick and prices were as you would expect from any other hotel which I thought were reasonable. Restaurant in hotel but never ate there. Only 6 floors with no windows overlooking Bloor street. Subway station below hotel. A few blocks from great designer stores/boutiques (Gucci, Prada, Tiffany, Roots, Holt Renfrow and many others). I will definitely stay there on my yearly trip to Toronto from the States.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard the Lazy: PARKING TIP IN REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: slee64f
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly over the subway giving it easy access to pretty much anywhere you would want to go in the city. The front desk was helpful and the workers were all friendly. Those that gave the hotel bad reviews based on the walking distance to the room should be ashamed of their laziness. I had a long discussion with the parking attendant related to the parking fees. As I was leaving I noticed that you can get the ticket validated by the hotel but when I expressed that to the attendant she told me not to do it. I guess if you get the parking ticket validated you get one free night of parking allowing you to leave and come back in but each additional day is $26 or $28 dollars. If you park the car and dont leave the structure for 3 nights or more the rate for parking without the ticket getting validated is only $16. So if you are staying for more than 2 nights and dont need to drive anywhere it is cheaper to not have your ticket validated.

Reviews.Title: “toronto Marrott”
Reviews.Author: jitendra04
Reviews.Content: very nice down town hotel with nearby shopping area and nice restaurants, large size rooms , very co operative staff.

Reviews.Title: “Choice Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: ahall88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least once a year, probably twice a year for the past 4 years. I noted on a recent trip that they had done some changes to the furniture in the room which was nice. I find the staff to be very good, many have been at the hotel a long time, and if you get to know them are really friendly. The hotel is in the right location for being right on the subway and near Yorkville. I have had excellent success in the past with suggestions from the concierge for restaurants. I wish the Regular Marriotts and JW's would just give free internet access to all rooms, like most of the lower brands. This is more of a complaint in regards to the branding and whats included. Charging $13.95 for internet is ridiculous, although at least this one included free access in their business services area. The last trip included the breakfast buffet which was a bonus. The service there was really good. I have been upgraded for access to the concierge lounge which can be nice for a drink in the evening/snack or for breakfast. A lot better and more reasonably priced than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “FAIR STAY COMPARED TO OTHER MARRIOTTS IN TORONTO.”
Reviews.Author: nkereina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Bloor Yorkville for one night on Saturday March 7th. I was in town with some friends for the World Baseball Classic at Rogers Centre. Even though it is a ways away from Rogers Centre, the hotel is connected to an underground shopping mall and the subway line so that made it convenient to get to Rogers Centre and other places. Check in was fine. We arrived around 6pm and were going to valet park but the valet guy told us it was $10 to self-park and $30 to valet. I'm not sure why they mark up the valet cost so high because it was really easy to self-park. The ramp garage was big and the elevator led right into the hotel. The room was really nice. Clean, spacious and decorated very tastefully. It was nonsmoking and had 2 queen beds, as I requested. The beds were very comfortable. Only complaint about the room was that it was boiling. I turned the thermostat down to 60 and it did nothing. This is the second time I've experienced this at a Marriott - I stayed at the Marriott Eaton Centre in Toronto about a month prior and I had the same complaint. When I made my reservation, I had also requested a room on a high floor and extra towels. There were several extra towels set on the bed for us when we walked into the room, but our room was on the 2nd floor - just down the hall from meeting rooms and banquet halls. Fortunately, nothing was going on at the hotel that night so noise was not an issue. The hotel was in a great location. It was centrally located on Bloor St, surrounded by shopping and restaurants. Just a short walk away ($6 cab ride) was the neighborhood of Yorkville which had great bars and restaurants. We hung out at one that was recommended by the bellman. It was called Hemingways. Really inexpensive and good food. The hotel's restaurant was under construction so we did not eat there. We ate breakfast the next morning at Over Easy which was great, and several blocks from the hotel walking. Just a month ago I stayed at the Marriott Eaton Centre. I probably would prefer that property over this one, due to it's location (we spend more time in the Eaton Centre area), and it was also bigger with a pool, etc. Marriott Bloor Yorkville was nice, however, and definitely got the job done for one night.

Reviews.Title: “horrid customer service- and good luck if you forget something there”
Reviews.Author: mistafairy
Reviews.Content: Our stay was brief thankfully, the tv didn't work, there was construction, so not the quietest - we allegedly stayed at an upgraded room - it was code for horrible decor really. my boyfriend forgot his watch there and their explanation was well we looked and it wasn't there. not recommended - 4 stars is an over rating for that hotel- the one good thing was the beds were comfy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location During A Deep Freeze!”
Reviews.Author: wannagotravel
Reviews.Content: We had been invited to a retirement party in Toronto and decided to make it a get away weekend. The hotel had been selected for it's affordability, proximity to the party and the underground access to the subway. Also very close to some good shopping. We booked the hotel directly by phone and our room rate was $ 149.00 per night, which included a breakfast for two each morning. The breakfast was excellent; lots of fresh fruit, eggs, meats, breads, cereals, yogurt, warm oatmeal etc. On Sunday morning we were able to order custom eggs/omelettes. It may have been available on Saturday morning as well, but we didn't know. Very friendly wait staff, as was all the other staff at the hotel. We used valet parking which is extra. If you are on a budget you could park your car on the very end destinations of the Toronto Transit system and take it to this hotel. Puchase a day pass for $ 9.00 which is valid for 2 adults or 2 adults with up to 4 kids 19 and under or 1 adult with 5 kids 19 and under. What a deal. Go to many attractions/shopping in minutes and no parking hassles and fees. Very easy to learn and any Torontonians we asked for directions were very helpfull. Some even walked us to were we needed to go. The room at the hotel was clean and cheery, the bed was excellent. The toiletries of spa quality. Everything was to our satisfaction. Our dinner at the hotel restaurant was also very good. Lunch was enjoyed elswhere. A magazine in the room called WHERE has lots of good information in respect to attractions, shopping, dining and transportation. The Royal Ontario Museum has some nice exhibitions at te moment and Friday night tickets are half price. ps Don't forget to tip the wait staff at breakfast because when you have a voucher they do not present you with a bill. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverabc123
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice restaurant, good location. Excellent all around. Especially good was the man with the mustache at the concierge/trip planning desk who was absolutely the most helpful hotel staff person I have ever met anywhere. He went above and beyond in helping us plan our activities etc. These are the things that stay with you after visiting a new city. The whole atmosphere at the hotel is positive. Room service was prompt and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sb_tor
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel via a priceline Bid and paid a really low price. We stayed for one night on a sunday night. The location is excellent, right on top of the subway. As others have mentioned, the room was pretty good without being awesome. No flat screen TV. We had a good view. Internet access is not free in the room, but you can go down to the business center and hook up your laptop, or use one of the many computers, even print out documents for free. In fact, they allow free photocopies (for the first 50 copies I think). Where this hotel excelled is in service. When we checked in, they noticed my infant daughter and immediately offered to send a crib and refrigerator to the room. When we got back home, I realized that my cell phone charger was back in the hotel. Called up the marriott, they actually have a lost-and-found department, and they mailed it to me quick and free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fine hotel in the Bloor Yorkville area”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Got a very nice room on the exec floor. The room was of a good size, the bed very comfortable and the room well maintained. The hotel is conveniently located closed to the Bloor Yorkville shopping area, subways and so on. That said, you don't want to stay there for the view as there is none. Staff was very attentive. Very good service in the bar lounge and in the restaurant (breakfast buffet). The (breakfast) buffet was of relatively good value (for Toronto). Tip: During the week-end use the self-parking option in the parkade beside the hotel - especially if you don't intend to use your car during your stay. Very inexpensive

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: victoria50
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm a loyal Marriott customer because their rewards program is the best. While this wasn't the nicest Marriott property I've ever been to, the staff here was phenomenal. Everyone we encountered from the front desk, housekeeping, waiters, were the friendliest, most hard-working I've seen in quite a while. It's amazing to be at a large chain and yet feel that you're at a small, boutique hotel property. Stay here if you want personal, caring service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice access to subways...”
Reviews.Author: linuscaldwell
Reviews.Content: but other than that the location sucked. We booked this off of priceline, so we got a really good deal (even after having to pay for parking), but we expected to be in the middle of downtown and it was a really far walk to the big malls, the good shopping, and the nightlife. However, the hotel is right on top of both of Toronto's subway lines, so it was pretty easy to get around (and the subway is very clean - nothing like NYC). Rooms and hotel staff were so-so - by far the worst Marriott that I've stayed at, but I've always been extremely happy at Marriott. Maybe they just have different standards for Mariotts in Canada. Basically, a good deal for the price we got on priceline (80 USD/night), but I sure wouldn't pay full price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe the size of the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: coochycoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Bloor Yorkville on a business trip a few weeks ago and thought it was great. The rooms are the biggest I've ever stayed in - absolutely massive! Plus the bed - well I could've easily gotten 6 people in it lying side by side - absolutely huge. The hotel itself is situated in the upmarket district of Yorkville with a shopping centre and subway station right underneath. Location-wise it couldn't be better. Rooms were comfortable and clean, fresh linen and towels everyday. I particularly liked the black out curtains which helped my jetlag! The only time we ate in the restaurant was for breakfast and it was adequate enough - you don't expect amazing service or selection at that time of day. All in all, if I were to go back to Toronto on business or pleasure then I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Way to Start Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: TCinSF
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel for our wedding, and we enjoyed our time here. We were upgraded to a suite with access to the Executive Lounge where we had breakfast in the morning and dessert at night. We also received complimentary bottled water and a lovely plate of truffled chocolates and fresh fruits. Front desk was friendly and helpful. Lastly, this hotel is in a fantastic location. It's in a vibrant area (during the day), surrounded by museums, shops and restaurants, and right on top of the metro station. The only downside to our stay was the decor. With so much competition from the Westin and Intercontinental chains, and boutique hotels, the outdated decor needs to be spruced a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Zeero
Reviews.Content: Most important note: Unless you are only staying in Toronto, get a hotel OUTSIDE the city. The parking fee is extremely high (some underground garage). It's almost 30 dollars. Spaces are all tight and limited. People were nice. Location was good. Right above the underground mall area. Room was kind of far, was a trek to get there. The rooms were pretty fair though. It's what you would expect. Some burnt out bulbs. A little dusty on the shelves and such. Good place to stay, but if you are renting/bringing a car, rent outside the city and drive in because you are going to get killed with parking fees. I think it's only worth it here if you plan on not having a car.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!”
Reviews.Author: mustluvdogs9
Reviews.Content: Had to change rooms twice in three days. First there was hair in the bathroom sink that appeared to be of the pubic variety, then the shower was clogged, and the thermostat broken. My new rooms were on the first floor, and the furthest possible rooms away from the elevator! All I got for my horrific experience was free breakfast at the restaurant downstairs, but even that was a nightmare, as on the last day, I found a hair on my sausage link! I will say that the bed was extremely comfortable, but given the bad experience, that was not enough to make up for the other goings-on. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GarPro
Reviews.Content: I attended a 2 day workshop at the Marriot Yorkville at the beginning of July. The organizers of the event booked rooms for the out of town participants. On arrival, the staff was cheery and helpful. I was quickly processed and up I went to my room. The hike from the elevator to my room was LONG (well not really long, just seemed like it, due to all the twists and turns in the hallway). The room was spacious and clean. No fridge/mini-bar. No wireless in the room - just a plug in port (I didn't use it). The bed was very comfortable - nice sheets and pillows. The bathroom was 'modernized' with granite counter, rain shower head, etc. No problems with water temperature, pressure or noise. Basic 25 or 27 inch TV. The meeting room was comfortable for the purpose of the workshop. The catering was EXCELLENT. There was always staff at hand to deal with any issues that came up (notebook connection to projector, temperature adjustment). Check out was quick and easy. I had my bag held by the concierge for the afternoon, before my airport car came. The lounge barkeep was friendly and entertaining (or may be we entertained him!!) The hotel sits conveniently above both the north-south and east-west lines of the Toronto Subway System (but many stories above - so noise is not an issue). Actually the 5th floor of the hotel (where my room was) is actually the 10th or 11th floor of the high rise building. Lots of area shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: nieluhpw
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nicely appointed. The staff was VERY friendly and proffessional. Great location, just above the subway station. As some of the reviewers have mentioned the bed is very comfortable. However, one thing I would say is that if you like your pillows to have a little spring to them, bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “slightly over-rated”
Reviews.Author: nondescripnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a four-star rating on Pricelin--the highest rating possible. So, I had high expectations, despite the Marriott brand... However, it was just a typical Marriott. Clean room, yes. Coffee maker, yes. TV, yes. Pleasant-enough staff, yes. That was about it. Some of the features advertised on Priceline as well as on hotel's own website/literature were not avaiable (e.g., no shuttle service to the airport, no gym/spa, etc.). All in all, this is a very good middle-class hotel. It certainly is NOT a four-star hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tlaquay
Reviews.Content: We won this lovely hotel through Priceline by choosing a 4 star Downtown Toronto Hotel for $75 per night. We drove up to Toronto for one night from Niagara Falls before returning home to Washington DC. This hotel was very easy to locate via Mapquest directions. The bathroom was pristine as was the bedding, however the carpet has seen better days. Also the room service from the Matisse restaurant in the Lobby was adequate and fullfilling. Big plus to this hotel is the proximity to high end shopping...Louis Vuitton, Tiffanys, Gucci, Escada, COACH, Pottery Barn and so on. Also as an added convenience PATH is located underneath the hotel. Which is the underground city of Toronto and easy access to the subway. Must do in this city is a visit to the CN Tower. If you eat at the 360 restaurant the views are breathtaking and the ride up is free. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel--Can't beat the convenience to the subway.”
Reviews.Author: Cincycaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Thursday 07-04-08 to Monday 07-07-08. Hotel is a bit older and as others have said finding your way from the parking garage to the hotel lobby can be challenging at first. We parked in the self parking at it cost us $42 for about 4 days, which isn't to bad. Pros- Bed--bed was absouletly the best I've slept on in a long time. Bathrooms- Bathrooms were newly remodeled and quite attractive. My fiance loved the look. Location- We rode the TTC 95% of the time. Didn't have to deal with parking or traffic and with the subway station being right under the hotel with access directly to the North/South Yonge and East/West Bloor lines, getting where we wanted to go couldn't have been easier. Cons- Courtyard- The room we stayed in was on the first floor and right on the ground level of the courtyard. Not a real big deal, but doesn't encourage you to open up the shades and you really need to make sure they are closed unless you want to expose your self to others. Fitness Centre-Fitness centre was closed for remodeling. Was looking forward to keeping up on my workout regiment and enjoying hte sauna. Lack of Pool- Really wish they had a pool or hottub of some sort. Overall a good experience. Rooms were clean and tidy and staff was pleasant. When weighing it against th $60/night we paid on priceline I couldn't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel - a typical Marriott property. Although I got a deal via Hotwire, my Marriott Rewards status was honored and I received free breakfast for two, and a half bottle of local wine. The room had all the standard amenities except there was no refrigerator/mini-bar. But it's a clean and comfortable hotel and would be great in the winter as it is literally on top of the Bloor/Yonge subway station. There's a stairway/elevator directly from the lobby to the shopping mall and subway which is just a few feet away. So if you're looking for a convenient location at Toronto's busiest subway station, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Marriott on Bloor before carting our son's belongings home from university. it is convenient to the Univ of Toronto area. The lobby is small and the one restaurant, just off the lobby, is very much lacking in ambiance. (Matisse would be upset that it has his name on it) Our room was not ready when we arrived so we experienced a meal in this restaurant. Banal. We were upgraded to a suite. It was a very very large room with oddly little furniture in it, and the TV so far away from the bed that it was hard to see it. However, there was only one easy chair, so we could not both sit in a place where we could see the TV. Other than a lot of square feet, I'm not sure why this was considered a suite. The view was of an interior courtyard, rather bleak. The room was very quiet and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom did not have a separate shower, which I prefer. We parked the car ourselves in the attached garage instead of using the valet service, which saves quite a bit. Overall this is a pretty utilitarian place to stay, but it is well located and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not a grand experience, but more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Devotee
Reviews.Content: Conference I was attending and presenting at was based here, so I made a reservation directly with the hotel. Not cheap but not outlandish - very straightforward. . Incredibly central, convenient location at the X'ing of two of Toronto's major avenues and subway lines. Land is dear, which explains why the reception, bar and breakfast restaurant are the only hotel spaces on the ground floor (adjoining the subway station) and the "1st Floor" is 6 flights above. My room had a dreary view of internal "garden" (i.e., an outdoor smoking space). . Check-in was adequate. I had a minor problem with my room service sandwich (missed the deadline to get "a real meal") which was fixed. The conference food that was served was above average. Room fixtures, upkeep and the housekeeping were outstanding. Note that unlike in the states, many of the Marriott rooms and spaces in this hotel were "smoking" - yuck. Still, my non-smoking room was ok. Bed was fantastic. Lighting was good. Bathroom excellent. . While Marriott quality was present and the service was good, nothing about this hotel (except its location at the Bloor and Young St. intersection) blew me away. I would stay here again, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

Reviews.Title: “Braved the Storm of March/08 in this awesome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Catalyst519
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel over priceline for $64USD =priceline fees per night over the weekend of March 7th and 8th, 2008. We were in town for some shopping, r n'r and a leaf's game. Check in was painless and quick. If you don't drive a Lexus or other 'Valet Worthy' vehicle park in the underground parking directly underneath the hotel. I honestly don't know how the person who complained about the hotel not telling them about the self-park option missed the sign to park. When you arrive at the hotel if you go straight--Valet, but if you head right off to the side-self park (RIGHT UNDER THE BIG GREEN P)---can't miss it. . . seriously. Cost us $12 and we were there 2 days. When we arrived at the room it was evident that it had been smoked in even though we requested a non-smoking room. A quick call to the front desk and a concierge was at our door in minutes carrying our luggage to a new room. In addition they provided us with a free breakfast voucher for the troubles. The new room (King delux) was clean, very spacious and very very clean. The bathroom was spotless and pleasant to use. Room was very quiet and peaceful. Bed was very comfortable but if you don't like feather pillows you have to ask for others to be sent up--no problem. Breakfast was awesome. Buffet style with many non-conventional gourmet choices such as fresh fruit and cheeses, variety of healthy cereals, eggs., bacon, western sandwiches and a personalized chef to create custom omelets and waffles. One of the better breakfasts I've ever had. But good thing for the voucher or I wouldn't have payed the $16 per person. This hotel is a stones throw from Young street and the busy downtown shopping district. However, we were weathering out the biggest snow storm of the year so we opted not to go outside. Cool enough is that this hotel is located directly on top of the underground Hudson's Bay Center. A short flight of stairs down from the lobby and your in this underground mall. Not much to see or do here but it is directly connected to the subway. On Saturday we caught the subway under the hotel over to the Eaton's Centre and spent the day in the "Underground City" exploring and shopping. Never even needed to bring a jacket or go outside at all. Sat night, again down to the subway to the ACC and the leaf's game. Right there with no difficulty. Plus the hotel staff are amazing and always willing to help you find your way (maps provided). All in all this was a great weekend away and this was a superior hotel as far as we are concerned. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Hopefully next time we're in T.O. Priceline will still be dealing with this hotel. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night - ok, but missed not having a pool and hotub.”
Reviews.Author: HotplateOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night - ok, but missed not having a pool and hotub. booked on Priceline for $55US Parking - Before I arrived i called the hotel to ask about parking - they told me the only paking available is Valet for $27 a day. They did not tell me there is a parking garage which can be accessed underground right next to the hotel. I was surprized it only cost me $10 for a 24 hour period. It is a little confusing to find your way but there is a door from the underground shopping area to the hotel. We toured around using the subway system - worked out good only $9.00 for a day pass for 2 people

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly service at the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: This past Saturday I had a very pleasant stay at the Marriott in Yorkville. Usually when I stay in this area, I stay at the Intercontinental but the Marriott I found to be more welcoming. I believe the hotel had just received an extra AAA star to bring it up to a four star property. I think the service was great and was part of the reason for the upgraded rating. I opted to go with valet parking for the weekend which gave me the flexibility to come and go as I please. The fee is $30 which is quite standard for central Toronto. The best part of the hotel is the location. There is a subway station in the same building and a shopping mall. There is also a great many of high-end boutiques on Bloor St. and in the Yorkville area. You should be able to reach everything on foot unless heading further south to the Theatre district or Eaton Centre. In the warmer months, you could reach the South attractions in the city in about 20 minutes. One thing that I thought was great about the hotel was the pet-friendly policy. This was the first time I had brought my cocker spaniel with me on a leisure trip and the staff made me feel very welcome! Most hotels (I assume) that are pet-friendly allow pets but would rather not have them on the property. The desk staff and housekeepers all stopped to pet my dog and all seemed genuinely happy to see him. There is a non-refundable fee of $50 for small dogs, which is valid for the duration of the stay. I think this price is fair, as the alternative of putting him in a boarding facility would have been even more expensive for the two days. I would say that if you have a dog, the Marriott is a great option! The room was very large and clean with a mundane view of adjacent buildings. The TV is a standard 25" unit and the washroom was nicely appointed in marble. The bed, was not as great as other four star properties I have visited and I found that the largest pillows should have been smaller. Other than that, I had a good night sleep. The other thing I noticed was how nice the housekeeping staff was. Whenever I left my room to go for a walk with my dog, they would all give me the biggest smiles and say hello. I thought they were very nice! There is also a business centre on the first floor if you need to connect to check email etc. I believe there were two computers and then two extra spots to hook up your own laptop. I would say that Marriott is a great option due to the outstanding location and warm service. The interior falls a little below the standards for a 4 star rating but would not deter me from staying here on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....stolen camera”
Reviews.Author: Vvlcek
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday evening and were able to get upgraded to an Executive Suite. The room was nice and clean and the location of the hotel was great. The bathroom is very small for a suite type room. The Marriott beds were great as usual. I stay in Marriott Hotels a lot. Before we left we unpacked and put everything away and realized that there was no safe in the room. I took my jewlery with me when we left the room but we left both of our laptops out on the desk top and my digital camera in my luggage with the zipper closed. When we returned from dinner the room had been turned down. The next morning I went to get my camera as we were going to visit some different areas of Toronto and I wanted to make pictures. The camera was gone. It was not a brand new camera but one of the original Canon Elf models. I called the front desk and told them the camera was missing and that we had looked in all of our luggage, in the car and torn the room apart. The young lady at the front desk checked with housekeeping and security and told me that no camera had been turned in. I stated again that I hadn't lost it but that I felt it had been taken. I asked that it be reported. At no point would they send anyone up to take a report. I was told no manager was available. I asked what else I could do but all that was offered was that she was sure it wasn't taken that if housekeeping had found it they would have put it on the desk. I know that I didn't lose the camera because I never removed it from the room. I know it was still in my luggage when I left the room....I saw it before I left. I cannot believe that this hotel didn't care enough to even send someone up to take a report. I doubt I will ever stay at this Marriott again. This is not typical treatment by a Marriott. If you do stay here be careful and don't leave anything of value in your room. I am in the travel business and I don't think I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for the "Younge" or Older Traveler”
Reviews.Author: siouxzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Marriott Toronto Bloor Yorkville on September 21, 2007 while in Toronto to see the Beastie Boys at Air Canada Centre. I named my own price on Priceline & got a very nice room for $55. The hotel location is excellent; there is a subway station right next door to the hotel (Bloor-Younge line). it is also connected to the PATH [--] which is an underground walk way with shops & restaurants. Taking the subway to the Union Station stop to get to the Air Canada Centre couldnâ€™t have been easier. The hotel has a parking garage connected to it offering self parking or valet. We went with self parking which cost $10 a day. Finding your way from the parking garage to the hotel lobby can be confusing, it felt like we were walking through a maze as there were no signs on the walls or doors telling us which direction to go. Upon check in we were treated very well by Bryan (itâ€™s been my experience when booking a room through Priceline or Hotwire that you arenâ€™t treated that great & are given one of the older rooms). However, Bryan treated us very well; he upgraded our room from 1 king bed to 2 queen beds with no problems (there were 3 of us traveling) & gave us a very nice room (room 105). He also gave us a map of the area & showed us how to get to the Air Canada Centre from the hotel. Our room was very spacious & clean with updated, modern dÃ©cor. The bathroom had a nice granite sink, plenty of extra towels & a hairdryer. Complimentary items included: A newspaper, coffee maker with coffee & teas; Bath & Body Works Orange Ginger Aromatherapy toiletries â€“ lotion, shampoo & conditioner; a shoe mitt, shower cap, a little baggie of Qtips & cotton balls, and 2 bars of soap.
